boardgame.name: Journey to the Savage Planet - Hot Garbage
boardgame.description:
Hello, Explorer!

We’d like to thank you for being an exemplary member of the Pioneer Program! In recognition of all your hard work, Kindred has decided to send you on a little trip to the fabulous beach planet of DL-C1! Consider this a "working vacation" since a) you’ll be working and b) the hours will be coming out of your vacation days. Fun!

The long and short of the situation is that DL-C1—you know, the quaint little beach planet we bought for a song a few years ago in a planetary foreclosure—has become covered in toxic filth. Who turned our little slice of paradise into a simmering stinkhole? Why did they do it? How can we somehow profit off this? That’s why you’re going. We need you to explore the planet, figure out who’s responsible, and gather all the evidence we’ll need to obtain a grossly disproportionate settlement in a court of space-law!

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Quoth the Raven (Issue 28 - October 2021)
boardgame.description:
From the Introduction to This Year's Theme:

2021 saw the release of a new version of Ravenloft in 5th edition. It’s an understatement that it’s not how we – old timer fans – would have done it. Some will like it; some will use this new Ravenloft to get inspiration. So, here’s this year’s theme: other options of how Ravenloft could be.

boardgame.name: Huis Clos: Saison 1 – Le Manoir Winsbury
boardgame.description:
In the heart of middle-class England in the 1920s, murderous passions are unleashed. The Yard sends you. Read the statements of the seven suspects and sort out the truth from the falsehood. Your goal: to identify the culprit.

Huis Clos: Season 1 - Winsbury Manor is a cooperative literary investigation game built like a detective series: 10 episodes, 23 characters, 10 victims. It's up to you to investigate!

Nearly twenty personalities will pass through the doors of the manor. The lure of money, the conquest of power and rivalries in love are all conducive to murderous passions. The local police immediately called the Yard, which sent its best detectives to help. That's you!

Players are guided by the instructions given on the cards. There are 7 suspects per investigation. For each character, the players have an identity card and a statement to read aloud and try to be the first to deduce the murderer in each "episode".

boardgame.name: Los Dorem & Las runas Mágicas
boardgame.description:
Today is a special day in the Dorem village, the wizards have decided to appoint a new apprentice. The meadow, as on the great occasions, is the place chosen for the ritual and up to four candidates will be able to participate.
Each player will play the role of an aspiring sorcerer who will compete for the position, showing his mastery of the rune tables and knowledge of sorcery.
Something tells me that the decision will be a tough one to make, because ...
what Dorem is not proficient in rune magic?

For 3 rounds, each player will try to charge as many of their crystals in the sorcerer zones with light, so that, at the end of each of these rounds, they will pick them up and take them to their rune tables, which will give them victory points. At the end of the game. Depending on how they are placed, they will form combos that will give them more or less victory points, and thus, the one who achieves the most will be named the new apprentice.


Hoy es un día especial en el poblado Dorem, los hechiceros han decidido nombrar un nuevo aprendiz. El prado, como en las grandes ocasiones, es el lugar elegido para el ritual y, hasta cuatro, serán los candidatos que podrán participar.
Cada jugador representará el papel de un aspirante a hechicero que competirá por el puesto, mostrando su dominio con las tablas de runas y conocimientos de hechicería.
Algo me dice que la decisión será difícil de tomar, porque ...
¿qué Dorem no domina la magia de las runas?

Durante 3 rondas, cada jugador tratará de cargar de luz el mayor número de sus cristales en las zonas de hechicero, para así, finalizada cada una de estas rondas, recogerlos y llevarlos a sus tablas de runas, lo que les proporcionará puntos de victoria al final de la partida. Según como queden colocados, formarán combos que les darán más o menos puntos de victoria, y así, el que más consiga será nombrado nuevo aprendiz.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Lost at Sea
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Lost at Sea is a solo journaling game of finding land in an unforgiving ocean. In order to play you will need somewhere to document your journey, preferably a physical journal, two ten sided dice, and a tarot deck.

This game takes 30-60 minutes to complete.

boardgame.name: Ptolus NPC Deck
boardgame.description:
From the publisher's store page:
Scores of personalities from every corner of Ptolus — at your fingertips!

Ptolus is a vast city, peopled with an amazing variety of dynamic characters. Ptolus: Monte Cook’s City by the Spire brings scores of them to life, complete with personality, quirks, relationships, and illustrations, as well as game stats. The 100-card Ptolus NPC Deck pulls these characters out of the book and into your game easily and conveniently!

On one side, each card gives you quick access to an NPC’s name, title and role, allies and opponents, characteristics, and other relevant information—plus the character’s page reference so you can look up further information and stats in the book. It’s everything the GM needs to give life to the character at the game table. And on the reverse: an illustration of the character to show the players.

The Ptolus NPC Deck is system-neutral, so it’s equally handy for both 5e and Ptolus GMs (or even GMs using the older, third-edition version of the book!).

PDF purchasers: To print your Ptolus NPC Deck, set your double-sided printer to short-edge binding and print on a cardstock material. Then, with a sharp utility knife and straight edge, use the crop marks as guides to trim the cards apart. If you don’t have a double-sided printer, print the pages individually and glue them back-to-back with a thin, even coat of adhesive. Before gluing, hold the back-to-back sheets up to a light source to ensure they are lining up correctly. The gutters between the cards give you a little bit of leeway if the two sides do not line up exactly.

boardgame.name: Ptolus GM Screen
boardgame.description:
From the publisher's website:
An entire city’s worth of handy info—at your fingertips!

The Ptolus GM Screen gathers loads of handy Ptolus-related info and puts it right where the GM needs it. Bring this amazing city to life with easy access to notable groups and characters, encounters, details of Delver’s Square, travel and provisioning options, and loads of other info that makes presenting the richness of Ptolus effortless for the GM. The reverse side features fantastic Ptolus artwork that pulls players into this vibrant, dynamic setting.

The four-panel Ptolus GM Screen is printed in landscape format on heavy game board, making it as sturdy and durable as it is beautiful. The information is system-neutral, making it equally useful to GMs of 5e and the Cypher System (and even to GMs using the third-edition version of Ptolus).

The PDF version provides pages sized to fit the World’s Greatest Screen from Hammerdog Games, or any landscape-format customizable GM screen. It includes 26 pages of alternate artwork—choose your favorite to display on the players’ side!

boardgame.name: Ptolus Character Portfolio
boardgame.description:
From the publisher's website:
An entire city’s worth of handy info—at your fingertips!
A Legendary Setting Builds Legendary Characters
Ptolus is a setting for epic campaigns, and epic campaigns mean epic characters! The Ptolus Character Portfolio does your character justice. At 24 pages, it records all your character’s abilities, skills, spells, belongings, and everything else you find on a conventional character sheet. Plus it gives you room for notes, sketches, and details. Jot down thoughts about your character’s appearance and mannerisms. Make notes about connections to the other PCs along with people, creatures, objects, and locations you meet in your adventures. Keep a campaign journal, or make maps and sketches of places you’ve been.

The Ptolus Character Portfolio is perfectly sized to provide plenty of space within, but without taking up too much space on the gaming table. It’s printed in full color on heavy matte paper that takes pencil and eraser easily. Even the cover is easy to write and draw on, making every player’s portfolio unique from the outside in.

Choose the 5e version or the Cypher System version. Either way, the Ptolus Character Portfolio in print comes in a pack of five—enough for the whole party. The PDF includes two files: one optimized for printing, and the other form-fillable for use on your computer or device. You get both files with your PDF purchase.

boardgame.name: Shape Shift
boardgame.description:
The competitive shape-building game that tests your reflexes and mental agility with some fast-paced fun!

Each card shows a shape challenge, ranging from a four-block puzzle up to the trickier eight-block and mystery challenges. Players race to see who will be first to build the shape shown on the card using their wooden blocks.

The first player to win 10 challenges wins the game.

boardgame.name: CookieRun: Kingdom Board Game
boardgame.description:
CookieRun: Kingdom Board Game is a worker placement territory building game based on video game, CookieRun: Kingdom, developed by Devsisters. In this game, you become a king of a delectable kingdom and compete with other players to make your kingdom as awesome as possible.

To do so, you place your worker, Sugar Gnomes, to collect resources and construct exciting and fabulous buildings. You also team up cookies to fight against evil monsters. And you may clear the overgrown forest to expand your territory even bigger.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Players: Games with expansions that add solo play

boardgame.name: Open Cases
boardgame.description:
Open Cases is a fast and fun card game. Find the truth behind unsolved crimes!

Be the first investigator to find the culprit, the weapon used and the real motivation. Don't let other players get in the way of your investigation and prove that justice always prevails.

boardgame.name: Mint Knight
boardgame.description:
Create your own adventure as you explore the lands, recuiting an army, defeating keeps, slaying dragons, and conquering castles.

In this 45 minute solo game, you will be managing your hand of cards to perform actions and achieve your goals. You will be slaying dragons and orcs, learning spells, finding artifacts, recruiting units and assaulting castles in your adventure.

Game features some hand management, light deck building, experience leveling, and a minature. All of this fits in a mint tin for you to take anywhere you want to go.

The goal of the game is to find the two castles and battle them before the end of the 4th round otherwise you lose.

boardgame.name: Blood Rage: 3D Clan Tokens
boardgame.description:
20 Sculpted Tokens - 4 for each of the Core Box Clans + 4 for the Ram Clan
from Blood Rage Digital Kickstarter

boardgame.name: Crítico: La revista de rol (nº 12 - Spring 2022)
boardgame.description:
From Publisher Blurb:

En este número de la revista Crítico encontrarás:

Jasconius y el decimoctavo discípulo. Una aventura para retroclones escrita por José Masaga.

Organizaciones de leyenda. Suplemento para Legend de Alfonso M. García.

Doce números de Crítico. Un repaso a la historia de la revista.

Pilares de una crónica. Un escenario para Vampiro: La Mascarada de Enric Muraday.

El rincón del experto. Cosas que te puedan suceder en el mar. Unos consejos para cualquier juego por Oscar Peña.

boardgame.name: Orsha 2025
boardgame.description:
Orsha 2025 is a small game published in the 45 issue of the Taktyka i Strategia (Tactics and Strategy) magazines in both Polish and English editions.

Game is set up in the World War 3 alternative history setting/system, taking place after Russian failed attempt to invade western Europe (Ardennes 2024, Waterloo 2025 games). After liberation of Poland (Grunwald 2025 game), western armies are attacking Belarus, aiming at Smolensk. Main battle takes place near the historical city of Orsha.

Game requires a set of system rules from any game of the series, along with some markers. It contains all units counters needed, along with board and scenarios.

boardgame.name: Champions Secular
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

So, you used to be a Cavalier, follow an Order, use your tactical abilities and challenge your foes? Now things have changed, the editions have evolved, and you are trying to be a champion. Some things are missing, some are different, and everything is under the watchful eye of your patron deity.

Within you will find the details of the Secular Champion class archetype, with its focus on challenge, tactics and resolve; the Affiliate multiclass archetypes which provides a route for multiclass secular champions; and the tenets of chivalry, heraldry, and heresy along with their common secular causes.

SECULAR CHAMPION

A secular champion follows an earthly cause free from the tenets of a patron deity. The secular champion class archetype replicates many of the features of the previous iterations of the Cavalier and Samurai.

TENETS OF CHIVALRY

Chivalric causes champion those they serve. The common chivalric causes detailed in this document are:

The Order of the Blue Rose dedicate themselves to promoting peace in the lands they roam.
The Order of the Dragon dedicate themselves to a group of like-minded individuals.
The Order of the Green are dedicated to protecting wild places and creatures.
The Order of the Land dedicate themselves to the land and the people who inhabit the rural areas between urban centres.
The Order of the Shield devote their lives to protecting the common folk, from the simple farmer to the honest craftsman.
The Order of the Sword dedicate their lives to the code of chivalry, living a life of honour, valour, and fairness.
TENETS OF HERALDRY

Heraldic causes champion the protection and propagation of their beliefs. The common heraldic causes detailed in this document are:

The Order of the Lion are pledged to a sovereign; be it a king, queen, or even the local warlord.
The Order of the Seal are a secretive order, each charged with the protection of a specific object, place, or secret.
The Order of the Staff dedicate their lives to guarding and assisting spellcasters, especially wizards and druids.
The Order of the Star dedicate themselves to the protection and service of a faith and its members.
The Order of the Tome devote themselves to the preservation of knowledge.
The Order of the Warrior swear themselves to the code emphasizes duty, honour, loyalty, and obedience.
TENETS OF HERESY

Heretic causes champion self-interest or a personal aesthetic. The common heretic causes detailed in this document are:

The Atheist Heresy are dedicated to hunting down anyone practicing, preaching, or otherwise facilitating religion.
The Errant Heresy find themselves without a master as a result of disgrace or death, or occasionally by choice.
The Penitent Heresy seek to make up for past crimes and do whatever they can to restore their tainted honour.
The Vengeance Heresy seek to punish those who betrayed them.
This champion's cause contains:

20 orders across 3 tenets.
100 champion feats.
30+ devotion focus spells.

boardgame.name: Champion Oaths
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

As a champion, you follow a cause. Your cause determines your champion’s reaction, grants you a devotion spell, and defines part of your champion’s code. Causes are split into groups called tenets that share common elements, and in turn the tenets fall into broad types. The champion series of Merlin’s Moments offer a greater selection of tenets and causes.

Oathbound Champion
The Oathbound champion with no cause other than a collection of oaths.

As a variant of the Champion multiclass archetype, the oathbound multiclass archetype greatly improves defences, particularly armor. It’s a great way for a character to gain armor proficiency or a powerful defensive reaction. It differs from the Champion archetype by focusing on oaths rather than a cause.

This variant multiclass champion:

13 multiclass champion feats.
37 Oath feats.
17 Aura feats.
7 devotion focus spells.

boardgame.name: Champions of Ethics
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

As a champion, you follow a cause. Your cause determines your champion’s reaction, grants you a devotion spell, and defines part of your champion’s code. Causes are split into groups called tenets that share common elements, and in turn the tenets fall into broad types. The champion series of Merlin’s Moments offer a greater selection of tenets and causes.

Ethical Tenets
Ethical tenets focus on the extremes of good and evil. Your cause must match your alignment exactly.

Tenets of Good, which all require a good alignment and includes the Paladin, Redeemer and Liberator causes.

Tenets of Evil, which all require an evil alignment and includes the Antipaladin, Desecrator and Tyrant causes.

This champion's cause collects:

6 good and evil causes.
50 champion feats.
It also previews the Secular Champion heraldic order of the Lion and the chivalric order of Sword.

boardgame.name: Champions of the Inquisition
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

As a champion, you follow a cause. Your cause determines your champion’s reaction, grants you a devotion spell, and defines part of your champion’s code. Causes are split into groups called tenets that share common elements, and in turn the tenets fall into broad types. The champion series of Merlin’s Moments offer a greater selection of tenets and causes.

Inquisition Tenets
Champions of the inquisition are even more devoutly tied to their patron deities and select judgements during their daily preparation.

- Inquisition of Destruction

- Inquisition of Excommunication

- Inquisition of Healing

- Inquisition of Justice

- Inquisition of Piercing

- Inquisition of Protection

- Inquisition of Purity

- Inquisition of Reformation

- Inquisition of Resiliency

- Inquisition of Resistance

- Inquisition of Smiting

- Inquisition of Stalking

This champion's cause contains:

1 tenet with daily selectable causes.
29 champion feats.
13 devotion focus spells.

boardgame.name: Champions of Protection
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

As a champion, you follow a cause. Your cause determines your champion’s reaction, grants you a devotion spell, and defines part of your champion’s code. Causes are split into groups called tenets that share common elements, and in turn the tenets fall into broad types. The champion series of Merlin’s Moments offer a greater selection of tenets and causes.

Moral Tenets
Moral tenets focus on the balance between law and chaos. Your cause must match your alignment exactly, although some moral causes allow for a range of alignments.

Champions of Protection
Champions with tenet of protection dedicate themselves to the staunch and unyielding protection of a ward - a specific group, person, location, or object.

CUSTODIAN

Custodians are champions of responsibility and duty. You offer protection because it is your obligation according to the law.

GUARDIAN

Guardians are champions of loyalty. Your word is your bond you protect your ward because of a historical, emotional, or genealogical connection.

MERCENANY

Mercenaries are champions of agreement. You protect to fulfil the dictates of your contract and receive your payment, offering valuable services for a fee to those who wish to pay for your protection. You are only bound to the strictures of your contract whilst it still benefits you and your compensation.

This champion's cause contains:

3 causes the lawful neutral Custodian the neutral Guardian, and the chaotic neutral Mercanary.
31 champion feats.
5 devotion focus spells.

boardgame.name: Champions of Absolution
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

As a champion, you follow a cause. Your cause determines your champion’s reaction, grants you a devotion spell, and defines part of your champion’s code. Causes are split into groups called tenets that share common elements, and in turn the tenets fall into broad types. The champion series of Merlin’s Moments offer a greater selection of tenets and causes.

Moral Tenets
Moral tenets focus on the balance between law and chaos. Your cause must match your alignment exactly, although some moral causes allow for a range of alignments.

Champions of Absolution
The champions of Absolution consider themselves above the petty squabbles of honour and ethics, devoting themselves to managing the flow of souls and the balance between the positive and negative extremes of the multiverse.

PURIFIER

You are dedicated to ensuring that souls are in control of their own fate and are not forced into absolution. Sometimes named as and confused with the neutral good redeemers, you right the wrongs of necromancy, free blighted souls from the curse of undeath, purify unhallowed grounds.

PROSELYTIZER

You are dedicated to ensuring that souls are delivered to their final absolution. You specialize in dealing with malignant spirits that reside in valued people or locations., residual undead devoid of purpose, and with powerful necromantic lords circumventing the river or fate.

This champion's cause contains:

2 true neutral causes the Proselytizer and the Purifier.
26 champion feats.
6 devotion focus spells.

boardgame.name: Champions of Resolution
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

As a champion, you follow a cause. Your cause determines your champion’s reaction, grants you a devotion spell, and defines part of your champion’s code. Causes are split into groups called tenets that share common elements, and in turn the tenets fall into broad types. The champion series of Merlin’s Moments offer a greater selection of tenets and causes.

Moral Tenets
Moral tenets focus on the balance between law and chaos. Your cause must match your alignment exactly, although some moral causes allow for a range of alignments.

Champions of Resolution
Free from the ethical consideration of good and evil, champions that follow the tenets of resolution instead are concerned with the application of law or the struggle to counteract its extremes.

JUSTICIAR

You are a merciless champion of the law, if you must crush dreams, coerce obedience, or slay in the name of the law, that is a small price to pay for peace and progress. You have joined the crusade against chaos, adopting a life of ironclad discipline and swearing to thwart disorder by any means. Through intimidation and strength of arms, you embody the grim fist of law, pursuing and crushing disorder wherever it festers. You may strike out from one of the stark, black citadels, or roam between cities and villages, serving as judge and emissary of a harsh vision of justice.

RADICAL

You devote yourself to counteracting the worst applications of the law, and the inflexibility of those that impose it. Although your cause is sometimes confused with the chaotic good liberator, you focus more on counteracting the extremes of law rather than freeing those impacted by it.

This champion's cause contains:

2 causes the lawful Justicar and the chaotic Radical.
28 champion feats.
5 devotion focus spells.

boardgame.name: Cult of Isis
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mystery cults are secret societies that exist within religious institutions. Like other secret societies, their existence is well known, but their rituals, lore, and objectives are concealed. Only the initiated are allowed access to these secrets.

This file provides an overview of mystery cults and specific details about the Cult of Isis, one of the most influential and widely known goddesses in the Amazons vs Valkyries setting.

Features:

Sample cult secrets
The location of Isis' main temples
Festivals held in Isis' honor
The Osiris Tale
3 New Legendary Magic Item (Book of Breathing, Knot of Isis, and Veil of Isis)
Paladin's Oath of the Great Lady

boardgame.name: Back to BasiX (Issue #11 - Mar 2022)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A bonus eleventh issue (March, 2022) of the Back to BasiX fanzine, from Thom Wilson at ThrowiGames LLC.

This fanzine celebrates, highlights and supports one of the original roleplaying game systems of the 1980's, the Basic and Expert editions of Dungeons & Dragons. Each issue will provide or highlight content within the Holmes, Moldvay, Cook and Mentzer edited rules from TSR's Gary Gygax and Dave Arneson. Features articles from James M. Spahn.

Issue contains: Product Spotlight, Spellbound article (Psionics), New Magic Items, New Monster (Weresquirrel), one short Encounter ("Death Canyon'), TWO full page comics "Dungeon Delvers" (artist, Travis Hanson), and interview with Jeff Dee (TSR artist and game creator), and new ongoing story/adventure.

boardgame.name: Stone of Sustenance
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An ancient relic that causes the land to prosper has been stolen. The Earl of Grinder has called upon you and your party to recover the artifact. The party will head north to recover the item and the climate change has already begun so time is of the essence!

This adventure setting was designed for 5th Edition AD&D in the Filbar Artifact Series for a 6 adventurers of 11th level and a DM.

boardgame.name: The Path of Hysteria
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A new Barbarian sub-class for 5E that helps you fulfill the fantasy of becoming a mindless force of destruction.

boardgame.name: The Consortium of Cartographers: Belmarsh Laboratory
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Named after the nearby sprawling marsh, Belmarsh Laboratory was acquired by the Consortium of Cartographers in order to conduct secretive research. Recently, Selvia Arorax has been hired by Wexford Draglam, successor to the honourable sage Krowcon, in order to find a way for living tissue to pass through Krowcon portals.

Belmarsh Laboratory is a premade, ready to explore, 5 level structure filled with 6 NPC’s. The laboratory can be added to any location and provides various plot-hooks, hidden locations, and secrets, offering open ended adventure and discovery for Players of any level.

Featuring:

Unique building art and map
Player, Game Master, and full size printable versions of the maps
A keyed version with 28 locations with descriptions of each room
6 NPC’s with descriptions

boardgame.name: The Consortium of Cartographers: Guildhall
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“Welcome to the Consortium of Cartographers Guildhall. We are the foremost experts for all your mapping needs. How may I assist you today?”

The Consortium of Cartographers – Guildhall is a premade, ready to explore, 5 storey structure. The guildhall can be added to any city, offering Player a location to purchase maps, cartographic supplies, etc. Hidden locations and secrets fill the building, offering open ended adventure and discovery.

Featuring:

Unique building art and map
Player, Game Master, and full size printable versions of the maps.
A keyed version with 29 locations with descriptions of each room

boardgame.name: Nekojima
boardgame.description:
In Nekojima, “The Island of Cats” in Japan, an electricity network is developing to supply the various lively districts of the island. The installation of electric poles becomes more complex due to the narrowness of the territory and its curious population of cats strolling on the cables.

Nekojima is a wooden game of skill and dexterity in which you will have to keep an entire installation in balance. Players must take turns placing or stacking Denchuu 電柱 (Electrical Poles) respecting the locations without any hanging cables touching. But be careful not to be the one to bring down the structure. This game requires reflection, concentration and skill.

In competition, the player who knocks down the structure loses.
In cooperation, the goal is to go as far as possible.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Nerovia III: Tooth & Nail
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

Nerovia is a land existing in a world of nightmares. This ancient place struggles against spirits, disease, and the unknown. The people are busy surviving between lunar cycles and harvest season. The winters are long. The mountains are steep. Sorrow so clouds this land that the shadows lead the living.

This adventure offers a rousing mystery in the forested mountain settlement of Brynmawr. Whether its's the roaming hunger of the Hunter Beast, or a foul plot to murder an otherwise harmless baker, there is something afoot in Tooth and Nail.

boardgame.name: Guimond's Light
boardgame.description:
An entry in the Tenfootpole Waverider Keep contest!

From the publishers blurb:

This ancient tower of stone watches over the waves, the tides, and the sea itself! What secrets lie within?

boardgame.name: Tales of the Dungeon
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Delve Into the Dark

Grab your torch and explore the dark and hidden places deep beneath the Realm with Tales of the Dungeon. From the Wraithlord’s Domain somewhere beneath the City to the Glittering Caverns of the Hollow Hills, you’ll find details on dungeons from one end of the Realm to the other. Within these pages, you’ll unlock a wealth of information to expand your Talisman Adventures Fantasy RPG campaign, including two new ancestries (minotaur and vampire), two new classes (necromancer and tomb robber), new rules for dungeon exploration, fiendish traps, dungeon-related gear and treatures, and new enemies, strangers, and followers. You’ll also find advice for designing your own dungeons and a complete three-level dungeon that brings the heroes face to face with the Lord of Darkness.

boardgame.name: Portland Occupied Zone
boardgame.description:
Portland Occupied Zone (POZ) is a semi-cooperative board game where you and up to seven other players roleplay as slacker activists trying to bring about Revolution in Portland’s fantasy Hawthorne District. The objective is to transform your neighborhood from a late-stage capitalist hellscape into a slacker Marxist utopia.

The game is turn-based. At the beginning of every round new Narratives and Aktions are drawn and voted on, and the police and the Medic will take their turns. There are no discreet game stages, but the early game will likely be focused mainly on looting and burning, which builds up your characters and the POZ. The Police are quite tough, and players are unlikely to be able to defeat them early on.

When space for building has been cleared out and players have amassed a large enough arsenal, it will be time to bring the fight to the Man. The police work on a simple AI (similar to Space Hulk). They will be relatively passive early on but their aggressiveness will increase as the POZ grows.

POZ is semi-cooperative, and there are two conditions for winning:

a) The POZ must be built up, the police must be defeated, and the courthouse must be occupied. This is a group effort which benefits all players.

b) Once the courthouse is occupied, however, only the player with the highest score is the winner.

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: The Keep of Dragon Turtle Greth
boardgame.description:
An entry in the Tenfootpole Waverider Keep contest!

From the publishers blurb:
Fear the tides! For upon the ocean’s black abyss rides a keep of stone on the broad shelled back of the mighty dragon turtle Greth.

Fear the tides! For unbeknownst to the fisher families of Stonewave the tides have turned against them.

Fear the tides! For this night, the vast body of Greth will beach itself upon the shore and a score of Iguanamen will be disgorged to raid the town for fresh human flesh.

Can the party fight off the Iguanamen raid in the night?

Can the party reach Greth in time to rescue the captives before he dives into the deep?

boardgame.name: Disciples of a Cracked Skull
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Over 400,000 years ago a young hominid was killed. What was left of their skull was broken into 52 separate pieces. This specimen is known as Cranium 17. Humanity is now in space. Skulls are still cracked.
The second installment of Rimbound Transmission. Issue 2 is Disciples of a Cracked Skull 12 additional weapons for you to improvise out in space, along with a custom wound table!

Included but not limited to

Chainsaws
Fireworks Launchers
Chemsprayers2

boardgame.name: For Queen and Company
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tengliu 3 is an ice ball planet currently owned by the Blackflame Intergalactic Company Mining Department.
While most of the surface of the planet is inhospitable to human life under the ground there is enough geothermal activity to sustain underground mining towns. A recent cave in near the Sandwith facilities has called for new employees. Just below the surface things are not how they seem.
Alien beasts have been unleashed and have replaced a cave in survivor with a drone. The drone has two goals, kill all humans and OBEY THE QUEEN.
The third installment of Rimbound Transmission. Issue 3 is For Queen and Company, a social deduction murder mystery for Mothership.

Inside you will find

10 NPCs
3 Monsters
1 Map of an underground mining facility
Reasons for any class to take this job

boardgame.name: Quixote Type ST Class Scout
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Quixote Type ST Class Scout is a 100dton general purpose light scout/courier class ship capable of 2G acceleration and Jump 2. It comes fitted with a user-defined Mission Bay and a Vehicle Hangar. This is a "tail-sitter" design with decks arranged along the acceleration axis.

This guide contains:

Ship art.
Blueprints.
Ship statistics and description.
Air Raft details and description.
9 pages of deck plans
(empty, cluttered, and with alternative mission bay layouts).
Design Specifications.
A choice of 8 pre-generated character cards for crew.
Set RollD20 Assets

boardgame.name: トリッククエスト (Trick Quest)
boardgame.description:
トリッククエスト (Trick Quest) is a trick-taking role-playing game from Japan. Players have RPG roles such as mage or fighter, and progress along an adventure path by winning tricks. When a player wins cards in suit matching their character, they can improve their abilities.

Each player gets a RPG character and work together to complete the quest. Players move along a path on a game board, and where the path diverges, they can split or stay together. Players can work up and down the path, repeating sections to build up their characters.

As players face each challenge, they play a trick-taking game. The suits correspond to the characters; armour for the martial artist, tools for the mage and wizard, ornaments for the monk and so on. By collecting cards in their suit, a character can get Trick Points (TP) and use them to upgrade their abilities, and to level up to unlock higher strengths.

Players win the game by completing the quest, finding the legendary GodBird and ridding the world of disease.
user summary
boardgame.boardgamedesigner: Professor Cheng (プロフェッサー：チェン)

boardgame.name: Gentsu
boardgame.description:
Gentsu is a card game from Japan. The designer works in the advertising industry in Japan, and modelled the game on the experience of an account executive. Players are trying to complete projects for famous brands (with mock IDs like Tayota) by working overtime. But events and accidents take their toll and cause problems. The player who completes the best projects is the winner.

The game was first produced in 2018 in a limited design with simple packaging, and then re-issued by the designer with improved cards and box design.

--user summary
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: gentsu 拡張版 v1.0.1 -Road to Molympic- (gentsu Expansion v1.0.1 -Road to Molympic-)

boardgame.description:
1866 Railways of Europe is a game in the 18xx family originally started by Francis Tresham. It has several unusual elements:

There are no stock rounds. Instead players buy stock turn tokens that activate interleaved with company operations on the stock market.
The map is divided by national boundaries.
National companies can only operate within their borders.
Minor National companies (regions in Germany and Italy) merge in mid game to form their respective national companies, reflecting events of the 7 weeks war in 1866.
Public companies are given operating rights across the map by directors ownership of National companies.

boardgame.name: Senjutsu: Battle For Japan – When Two Worlds Collide
boardgame.description:
Comes with two 32mm miniatures (Yasuke and Wakou Pirate) and 104 ability cards including each character's signature cards, kamae trees, new base ability cards and their own unique solo decks.

Armed with a mighty kanobo club and a jar of Sake (I don't know which is more lethal!) The Wakou Pirate is off the high seas and ready for a drink and some carnage!

Yasukeo is armed with blades like the Katana and Wakizashi.

boardgame.name: Senjutsu: Battle For Japan – The Wolf At The Door
boardgame.description:
Comes with two 32mm miniatures (Onna-Bugeisha and Yojimbo) and 104 ability cards including each character's signature cards, kamae trees, new base ability cards and their own unique solo decks.

The Onna-Bugeisha fights with a simple Naginata and passion for her home in her heart. The Onna-Bugeisha is one of the characters in Senjutsu that comes with their own unique special rule. The More damage she takes during combat the more ferocious and determined she becomes.

Yojimbo is armed with blades like the Katana and Wakizashi.

boardgame.name: Senjutsu: Battle For Japan – Legends
boardgame.description:
Comes with two 32mm miniatures (Miyamoto Musashi and Sasaki Kojiro) and 104 ability cards including each character's signature cards, kamae trees, new base ability cards and their own unique solo decks.

Musashi is armed with blades like the Katana and Wakizashi.

Kojiro uses a variety of weapons unavailable to the other characters.

boardgame.name: Masai
boardgame.description:
Masai is a dice and seed allocation game that is fun and full of interaction. Players take on the role of a Masai mother and must make one of the beautiful traditional necklaces of the Masai people. It's just a single necklace, with limited spaces. Therefore, the best strategy to gain control of empty areas and spaces will be crowned with victory!

In Masai, players compete to fill empty spaces in a single necklace. For this, a draw is carried out at each round, where players choose two dice, one to access a sector and the other to place it inside the necklace. The player must check if there is already a die with the same face in the selected sector, as there can only be one face of each type in each location.

Players score points each time they fill an empty spot on the necklace and also receive points for links and for controlling areas within sectors. The game ends as soon as the players have no more space to fill in the necklace, the player with the most points wins the game.

Masai is simple but intense and cerebral, don't miss this challenge and become the best Masai craftsman.

boardgame.name: El Gran Circo
boardgame.description:
With a different proposal to everything comes El Gran Circo (The Great Circus). A tightrope that all the characters climb in each game to reach the final.

All the characters always participate in the game and each player can move any character on his turn. Each participant throws their cards to move all the characters strategically and get theirs to arrive first to win the game. An alternative proposed by El Gran Circo is the cooperative game, where players share a common goal: get all characters across the tightrope in 35 moves or less. For this, it will be necessary to work as a team and jointly analyze each move made by the participants on their turn.

In addition to entertaining the participants, El Gran Circo stimulates cognitive functions, helps regulate emotions and works on social skills.

boardgame.name: Bridge Constructor: Breaking Point
boardgame.description:
Engineer the best bridge you can with limited supplies and cross vehicles successfully. The tabletop game keeps the puzzliness, the wackiness, and the fun of the mobile game while expanding into areas that are uniquely suited to the tabletop realm, such as: In-person, face to face multiplayer action, unexpected events to confound other players, the ability to cross tons of vehicles, and more.

The gameplay is half puzzle and half press your luck. Each round you'll pick a bridge tile and either continue to strengthen or rebuild your bridge or use the tile to cross your vehicles. Choose from Super Light, Light, Medium, or Heavy vehicles that each have their unique points and challenges. Watch out for your fellow engineers though, at anytime they might play an event card on you, unleashing devestating damage to your perfectly planned bridge. Who's got the smarts to cross more vehicles and gather the most points before time runs out?

An easy-to-learn and difficult to master game of tile placement, hand management, and press-your-luck that everyone will enjoy.

boardgame.name: Gran Chef
boardgame.description:
Are you ready to become a Gran Chef? The objective is to be able to make the recipes that the game proposes, using money to buy food in the different stores that the route of the board has and buy only the exact amounts of each ingredient. This game invites you to train mathematical operations at two possible levels of difficulty. Awarded for "Let's Play Together" in the inclusive game design contest.

The objective of the game is to first get all the food that your recipe needs. You can play two levels: on the first level, the missions propose you to get food according to its value (additions and substractions); on the second level, the weight of each food is also added (multiplications and divisions).

On each turn, the player will throw the dice. When they fall in a store, they can buy everything they need for their recipe. Calculations should be done by the player, for younger kids there is a multiplication table to help. Each lap on the board, the player earns $50. The player who buys everything needed for their recipe, wins.

boardgame.name: Puzzlement in the Potager
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You are lost in a miniature wood in the Feywild. To leave requires a special potion. But what secrets hide between the mushrooms and tea cups?

A Two-Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for 5 APL 3 characters.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Witchlight Insecurity
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

When the party investigates the absence of security at the Witchlight Carnival, they find that two feywild domains have collided - will the party arbitrate or be crushed in between?

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 3.

Created as part of the Adventurer's League Dungeon Craft program, the module takes place in the author's Domain of Delight.

Designed to give high player agency, the role-play heavy comedic adventure includes five alternate endings, four optional encounters, and five full-color maps.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Escolar's Grotto
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Escolar is a restaurateur in the Tidalbore Isles, a Fey wild Domain. He operates a café from his small island home serving Sushi and Seafood to customers. Recently when he was at his favorite fishing spot on a secluded island he discovered a tunnel leading to a hidden chamber full of treasure. After telling his story to all his customers, word of the treasure made its way to the coven of sea hags who are the pirate queens of the Tidalbore Isle. They dispatched one of their pirate crews to kidnap Escolar and get the treasure for themselves. Can your brave adventurers rescue Escolar and foil the pirates' plans?

A 4-Hour Teir 1 Dungeoncraft (AL) Adventure for Characters of Level 1st-4th. Part 2 of The Tidalbore Isles Series. Optimized for a group of 5 players with an APL3.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Expedition to the Supreme Forge
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Allies reveal the location of the Supreme Forge: the origin of Xorvintroth’s unique blend of artifice and magic. The answers to controlling the city’s dangerous artifacts lie within for those brave enough to recover them.

Part Four of the The Cold Dark series of adventures. A Dreams of the Red Wizards: Terminal Ambitions Adventure.

A four hour adventure for 11th through 16th level characters.

Optimized for: APL 13

Content Warnings: oppression (mentions slavery), mental health (hallucinations), environmental hazards (Far Realm effects), death (explosion, decapitation, character disintegration).
boardgame.rpgseries: DDAL - Dreams of the Red Wizards

boardgame.name: Calling Upon the Dead
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A séance among friends new and old leads the investigation somewhere deeper and darker than ever before. Conjuring the restless spirits of slain adventurers, you rely on them to guide you to the next piece of the puzzle.

The twelfth adventure in the Ravenloft: Mist Hunters series of adventures.

An adventure for 7th level characters.

CONTENT WARNING: death of loved ones, grief, undead imprisonment and enslavement.Mentions (mass murder, murder of families, and suicide).

boardgame.name: Underwater Cities: Building Box Promo Card
boardgame.description:
Building Box is a green endgame special building that costs 3 credits and grants you 12 VP if you have at least one building of each type (regular + upgraded) by the end if the game.

This promo card was given for free in Spielbox 01/2022.

boardgame.name: gentsu 拡張版 v1.0.1 -Road to Molympic- (gentsu Expansion v1.0.1 -Road to Molympic-)
boardgame.description:
gentsu 拡張版 v1.0.1 -Road to Molympic- (gentsu Expansion v1.0.1 -Road to Molympic-) is an expansion pack for the Japanese game gentsu. It adds in new cards to satirise the run up to the 2020 Tokyo Olympics in the advertising industry.

Players have a big chance to be promoted to the "Extreme Paradise Account Manager" that all employees long for. This means working long hours in the agency Nightless Castle, so called because they never turn off the lights.
user summary

boardgame.name: House Kamael
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Learn all about Defiant House Kamael and put your Characters in all manner of perilous situations!

Twelve Great Houses bound their fates to the Sephirot and forged the Defiant alliance. They remain the most powerful among the aristocrats ruling over the Domains. There are, however, many more supernatural bloodlines that have joined the Defiant cause. One of the most notable among them is the angelic House Kamael. Angels of Grace can be found in almost all Domains, making them one of the largest and most influential Houses outside the Twelve.

In this Defiant supplement, you will learn more about Angels of Grace, their history, and customs. Additionally, you'll find rules and advice on creating Player Characters with preexisting dire problems and problematic situations.

CW: discrimination against a group
If you feel that dealing with the topic of a group being mistreated by others might be problematic for you, you should skip the "House Kamael in New Hethlon" part of the first Chapter. The second Chapter's information can still be useful, as it doesn't presume the nature of the bias against the Characters. Perhaps they are punished for something they are personally responsible for or have a powerful personal enemy.

boardgame.name: Wilderness Dressing: Mountains (2.0 - 5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Wilderness Dressing: Mountains presents:

Minor Events: One table (100 entries) presenting minor events to enliven your characters’ wilderness travel.
Minor Dressings: One table (100 entries) presenting interesting minor terrain features of note.
Uneventful Day's Travel: One table (20 entries) presenting descriptions of uneventful days on the road.
Campsites: One table (20 entries) presenting campsites to add details to your characters' overnight wilderness trips.
Random Encounters: One table (12 entries) presenting ready to use random encounters.

boardgame.name: Como Perros y Gatos...
boardgame.description:
An illustrated card game with different dogs and cats that compete to see who is the tallest of all. It can be played in 3 different ways:

1. Higher-lower numerical relationship: Competing among all the players which is the highest number.

2. Mathematical game: Where the cards are related looking for additions and subtractions, whose results are the key to winning.

3. Coincidence Memotest: Playing with characters and numbers.

boardgame.name: このドラマがすごい！ (Kono Drama ga Sugoi!)
boardgame.description:
このドラマがすごい！ (Kono Drama ga Sugoi!) is a card game from Japan based on making a TV drama. The players are television producers, and are trying to come up with a hit TV drama. The game title means something like 'This draam is amazing!'. Putting together hands in a poker style, players want to combine screenwriters, actors, directors and more to create the best TV dramas.

In the game, the numbers equate to the audience rating and are important. But an excellent producer also needs to win prestigious awards, decide on overseas remakes, and synergize with the theme song. The players try to create a wonderful Japanese TV drama that will impress many viewers, convince the office, and make everyone happy!
user summary

boardgame.name: Canté Pri!
boardgame.description:
Game of speed and visual acuity. Super fun and engaging! The deck is distributed among all the players and a card is placed in the middle to start, then everyone at the same time turns over a card from their deck until a participant finds the coincidence of the images or shadows.

At that moment it is discarded and the game continues with that card. Whoever runs out of cards first wins.

boardgame.name: Rive
boardgame.description:
Rive is a territory game for two players, Black and White. It is played on the cells of a small hexagonal grid with an odd number of cells, and the goal is to have the most stones on the board when it is full. The board is initially empty. Rive was invented by Mark Steere in 2010.

Definitions:
A cluster is a connected set of stones in any combination of colors (only white, only black or both).

There are three kinds of placement, all of which consist in placing exactly one stone of your color on an empty cell:
You plant when you place adjacent to no clusters.
You grow when you place adjacent to only one cluster.
You merge when you place adjacent to multiple clusters.

The only other kind of action is to shrink a cluster, which is to remove stones from it without splitting it into multiple clusters. This action will sometimes involve removing multiple stones, which may be of any combination of colors.

The basic structure of a turn is this:
You must plant if you can, otherwise you may grow or merge. If you merge, you must also shrink, then move again. This means that you may not end your turn before you have made a non-merging placement.

Restriction on growing and merging:
If you cannot plant (and therefore must grow or merge), you must choose a move such that the largest cluster you place adjacent to is as small as possible. This means that you cannot always choose freely between growing and merging, even though you aren't obligated to plant.

Restriction on shrinking:
The cluster resulting from the merging placement must be shrinked down to a cluster of size one more than the biggest cluster that was merged.

boardgame.name: Cult of Artemis
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mystery cults are secret societies that exist within religious institutions. Like other secret societies, their existence is well known, but their rituals, lore, and objectives are concealed. Only the initiated are allowed access to these secrets.

This file provides an overview of mystery cults and specific details about the Cult of Artemis, one of the most powerful and influential goddesses in the Amazons vs Valkyries setting.

Features:

Sample cult secrets
The location of Artemis' main temples
Festivals held in Artemis' honor
The Forest Domain
New Spell (canine companion)
Paladin's Oath of the Wild

boardgame.name: Toque y Gol
boardgame.description:
To know and enjoy football, whatever the result!

Each manager chooses his team, arranges it on the court and the game begins.

The winner is the first to convert two goals to the opposing team. Each play is said out loud and then the number the die rolls decides what will happen. For example, if you reached the area you can kick directly to the goal only if you get 3, 4 or 5, and it is a goal only if the goalkeeper rolls a number greater than yours, but if the goalkeeper rolls the same number as you or more high means you saved that attempt.

boardgame.name: Blitz Bowl: Ultimate Edition
boardgame.description:
Smaller in scale but no less bloody, the six-a-side version of Blood Bowl gets a new season, bringing you more gory gladiatorial action on the gridiron. With streamlined rules that are simple to learn, but rewarding to master, you can get into the game at a breakneck pace – quite literally, for some players.

This season, two new teams are ready to tussle in a tumultuous try-out – six Human players form The Reavers, while six Skaven make up The Scramblers. You’ll also get a pitch, cards, dice, and everything else you need to play an action-packed strategic sports game for two – in less than an hour.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Warhammer Quest: Lost Relics
boardgame.description:
A band of heroic Stormcast Eternals awaken within a mysterious labyrinth, filled with arcane treasures, devious traps, and vicious monsters. Will these four heroes (and their faithful pet bird) be able to break free, or are they doomed to fall at the hands of the mysterious Magister?

Work together with up to three other players to escape your prison in Warhammer Quest: Lost Relics, a co-operative dungeon crawler with intuitive rules, endless replayability, and games lasting a little over half an hour. You can even play solo, and test your wits against the all-powerful entity that rules the maze.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Root: Card Sleeves
boardgame.description: Protect your Root cards with this 54-count card sleeve pack. These sleeves have a clear front and glossy back, featuring the same card back artwork found in the Root base game. Sleeves fit cards sized 66mm x 91mm.

boardgame.name: Oceans: MeepleSource Painted Wooden Fish Meeples (240 pieces)
boardgame.description:
Beautifully painted set of wooden fish for the game Oceans, by North Star Games.

The 240-piece set includes 20 fish meeples for each type of fish:

Clownfish
Jewel Damselfish
Black and White Damselfish
One Spot Fox Face Rabbitfish
Royal Blue Tang
Flame Angelfish
Copperband Butterfly Fish
Saddle Wrasse
Seahorse
Clown Triggerfish
Orange Spotted Filefish
Powder Blue Tang

boardgame.name: GOOCON Dice Baseball
boardgame.description:
Baseball dice game with elements of Sun Tzu's Art of War

· Both sides take turns rolling the dice, and the two characters of the dice represent the result.
· Whoever scores the most at the end of nine innings wins, or whoever gets 18 first.
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Goocon CO., LTD (雁隼有限公司)

boardgame.name: The LOOP: LevityGames Meeple Sticker Upgrade Vinyl Sticker Kit
boardgame.description:
THE LOOP meeple sticker upgrade kit. Includes 10 large retro-illustrated stickers. A front and back for each character in the game.

Stickers are readjustable to get the right fit.

boardgame.name: Lost Ruins of Arnak: LevityGames Meeple Upgrade Meeple Stickers
boardgame.description:
Explore the Lost Ruins of ARNAK with these beautiful vinyl stickers from Levity Games! We have also added the Expedition Leaders Expansion to the set!

Each set comes with a sticker version of the characters on the cover of the boxes. You can choose which explorers you use for each player color!

What it comes with:
40 beautiful stickers for each meeple! Each charming explorer has a front and back sticker for each meeple as well as the Journals, and the Magnifying glasses.

The vinyl stickers are readjustable to get the right fit.

OPTIONS:

ARNAK + Expedition Leaders: This set now includes all six character designs from both the base, and expansions.

Expedition Leaders: This is the expansion only stickers. This adds 3 new character options to our previous ARNAK Set.

boardgame.name: Wild Space: LevityGames Meeple Upgrade Kit
boardgame.description:
Vinyl meeple stickers for the meeples in Wild Space.

Two sets of stickers available:
1. Standard Wild Space meeples includes 50 space ship meeple stickers.
2. Promo Wild Space meeples includes 50 Space ship meeple stickers, each color with a unique design and shape.

Stickers are readjustable to get the right fit.

boardgame.name: Magic: The Gathering – Streets of New Capenna
Magic: The Gathering — New Capenna Commander: Bedecked Brokers
Magic: The Gathering — New Capenna Commander: Cabaretti Cacophony
Magic: The Gathering — New Capenna Commander: Maestros Massacre
Magic: The Gathering — New Capenna Commander: Obscura Operation
Magic: The Gathering — New Capenna Commander: Riveteers Rampage
boardgame.description:
This noir-inspired expansion for Magic: The Gathering takes place in an art deco city built by angels, but ruled by demons. Five crime families, each spanning three colors of mana and led by a demon mob boss, vie for control of New Capenna.

The five families are the Brokers (green, white, and blue), a demonic law firm; the Obscura (white, blue, and black), a cabal of scheming wizards; the Maestros (blue, black, and red), elite assassins with a passion for fine art; the Riveteers (black, red, and green), a guild of rough-and-tumble artisans and crafters; and the Cabaretti (red, white, and green), hosts of the city's most lavish parties.

The set contains 281 cards. It is sold in draft boosters, set boosters, collector boosters, theme boosters, and bundles.

boardgame.name: TérrAq
boardgame.description:
TerrAq’s eco game goal is to find ecological actions aimed to rescuing vulnerable species and their endangered habitats.
By using different strategies, it will be possible to become guardian of marine and continental regions, occupy sanctuaries and biodiversity’s paths for fulfilling the missions. Victory points will be earned for each of these achievements.

During the game a dialogue is established in which words like Educate, Protect, Recycle... are part of the gaming experience. TérrAq does not explain how to become ecologically aware, instead in its own dynamic various concepts are transmitted through emotions generated by a fun and challenging game proposal.

BONUS: The back of the board presents a second game proposal. A space for debate that expands the possibility of reading and interpreting the information.

boardgame.name: Magic: The Gathering – Commander 2021: Strixhaven Commander – Silverquill Statement Deck
boardgame.description:
This preconstructed commander deck is part of the Commander 2021 set. It is a white-black deck with a political theme and a +1/+1 counters subtheme, featuring Breena, the Demagogue as the face commander. Each of the five Commander 2021 decks ties into one of the five colleges featured in Strixhaven: School of Mages; "Silverquill Statement" is based on Silverquill College.

This deck contains 100 cards, 10 double-sided tokens, 1 display commander, 1 life wheel, and 1 cardstock deck box.

boardgame.name: King's Cup Extreme
boardgame.description:
King’s Cup Extreme is a laugh-out-loud party game. Sometimes refereed to as Kings or Ring of Fire, this classic college drinking game has been revamped for a more widespread audience.

This deck includes fan-favorites from across campuses nationwide plus new, never-before-seen cards. To succeed in this updated version, you’ll need to be quicker, smarter, and of course, thirstier.

Each of the 120 cards has instructions so you can play instantly, no need to explain the rules to your guests. Simply pull a card, follow the command, and kickstart your night! The game ends when the fourth Hail To The King card is drawn and losing player is sentenced to drink the King's Cup.

The cards are 100% waterproof. Spill all you want, these cards won’t get damaged.

Alcohol is not required, any beverage is suitable.

boardgame.name: Table Battles: Great Battles of Prince Charles Alexander of Lorraine
boardgame.description:
Great Battles of Prince Charles Alexander of Lorraine is the sixth expansion to Amabel Holland's Table Battles, taking as its subject the not-exactly illustrious career of its namesake. Oh, the six battles in this set are "great" battles, including some of the most famous engagements of the eighteenth century. But they're not famous because of Charles, who is widely regarded as one of the worst commanders in history. They're famous because of guys like Frederick the Great and Maurice de Saxe, who ran circles around our boy Chuck, inflicting one humiliating defeat after another. Of course, the battles didn't have to end the way they did, and perhaps with your skill and a little luck, the outcomes might be very different!

This builds on some of the layers added in the last two expansions, and adds some new wrinkles of its own! Linked formations support one another, and tactical victory conditions allow you to win by attrition when a more decisive outcome is out of your grasp. Cards are demarcated as Infantry or Cavalry formations (with illustrations!), and the new Shift mechanic allows you to move forces of a certain type from one card to another. This not only can shore up places where your lines are weak, but if you concentrate enough force in one area, the resulting Oblique Attack can inflict heavier casualties on the enemy.

boardgame.name: The Shepherd Guide
boardgame.description:
From the publisher website:
Description
The Shepherd Job Guide includes everything you’ll need to dig into Yeld’s oldest and most loved Heroic Job. In this guide you’ll find the history of Shepherds and the roads they built across Yeld, going back to the days of the ancient Fairy tribes.

We’ve collected all the Shepherd specific content from the Yeld rule book and reprinted it here, along with a brand new Job Ability: Road Hymns!. We've also included a selection of new Special dice for both the Shepherd and their Flock and new items for you to collect! You’ll also find a brand new Mentor who is ready to send a young Shepherd on a quest to unite all of Yeld.

This guide also includes advice for building and playing different types of Shepherds. Learn the secrets of the spell casting Road Scholar, the deadly Highway Robber and the community minded Town Crier!

boardgame.name: Mac and Lee
boardgame.description: Mac and Lee is the second game in John Theissen's American Civil War Operational Series. Specific units and their strengths are hidden from your opponent as you perform a tense dance of cat-and-mouse maneuvers. This is especially important when modeling George McClellan’s ill-fated Peninsula Campaign, where doubts about enemy numbers and positions exacerbated the extreme caution that saw the promise of “the young Napoleon” give way over the course of these operations to his reputation as a passive, bewildered commander who was hopelessly outmatched by his Confederate counterparts. If they want to succeed, the Union Player will need to be bolder and more decisive than Mac; the Confederate Player, for their part, must use a skillful mix of maneuver, bluff, and nerve to stymie the enemy’s advance on Richmond. Knowing when to attack and when to hold back, when to run and when to make a stand, are paramount, and as ever, subject to the fortunes of war.

boardgame.name: The Soul Thief Guide
boardgame.description:
From the publisher website:
Description
The Soul Thief Job Guide is a new expansion for The Magical Land of Yeld, with everything you’ll need to dig into Yeld’s most deadly and feared Heroic Job.I n this guide you’ll discover the story of the very first Soul Thief, meet the mysterious Archivist and learn of the destruction of the secret Soul Thief Order at the hands of the Hunters of Yeld!

boardgame.name: Golfie
boardgame.description:
Golfie is a family game for 7+ years. 1 to 8 players
Lets play golf together! Take turns announcing the action to be played to all players by revealing an action card. Unveil, move and try to make combos!
Beware of the crocodiles that will make you lose your ball. Complete the 18-hole course by collecting your low-value cards to get the lowest score and win the game!

Solo mode (1 player)
Team mode (2v2 or 3v3 or 4v4)
Versus mode (2 to 8 players)

boardgame.name: Vault of Magic
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Find new powerful magic, and mysterious and terrible objects lurking within Vault of Magic!

Through this supplement, you can expand and enrich your ... world.

boardgame.name: Vault of Magic II
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Discover powerful and fearsome magical objects, spells, backgrounds, and NPCs to enrich your world.

boardgame.name: Ah Ouinnn? Édition 25+
boardgame.description:
The idea of this game is to guess the order of preference of other players among 5 subjects. The more you guess accurately, the more points you earn. Cards are different, with topics for adults aged 25 or more.

Bringing laughter, discussions and small malaise, this game is excellent at parties, dinner or date. Learn more about who you play with.

—description from the publisher (translated)

L’idée de ce jeu consiste à deviner l’ordre de préférence des autres joueurs parmi 5 sujets.

Plus vous devinez avec précision, plus vous gagnez de points.

Portant à rire, aux discussions et aux petits malaises, ce jeu est excellent lors de party, de soupers ou de date. Apprenez en davantage sur la personne avec qui vous jouez.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Wanderer's Guide to Merchants & Magic
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Though magic items play an important role in every great adventure, there’s precious little help to find when it comes to buying, selling, and trading magic items in fifth edition.

Wanderer’s Guide to Merchants & Magic aim to set that right by bringing you everything you need to make dealing with
magic items fun and easy.

boardgame.name: StarCluster 4 Magazine 4: The Devil in the Details
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

StarCluster 4 Magazine 4: The Devil In the Details examines the details of spacefight technology, exploring Stacked Drum construction methods, airlocks and docking ports, the inside components of a Jump Drive, what it is like to navigate through a Jump, how scan works and things a scan operator can do, How stealth works in space and different methods of stealthing a xhip. and how shields and other protective systems work.

boardgame.name: Sockjaw
boardgame.description:
Sockjaw is a card game of winning pairs of matching cards from a 5x5 grid. It is played with a traction 52 card deck of playing cards.

There are three possible types of pairs that can be captured from the grid.

The aim is to take as nearly equal a number as possible of each of the three types of pair.

boardgame.name: RedHack
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

RedHack is a d20 system that blends modern character customization and OSR gameplay philosophies.

Character creation is classless, relying on a limited number of highly impactful options.

As PCs level, they will become more skilled and efficient, but HP does not significantly increase. There are no insignificant threats or monsters.

Surviving to level 10 is an achievement. Balancing resources (such as luck, consumables, and HP) and making smart decisions will give PCs the edge they need.

RedHack is a concise, complete package that contains Player Rules, a GM Guide, a Bestiary of 24 classic foes, and a sample adventure. It’s also fairly easy to run other system’s adventures with on-the-fly conversions.

boardgame.name: Old School Blue Map #08
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The PDF has multiple layers allowing the options for numbered/non-numbered areas, secret doors on/off, and grid/no grid and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

boardgame.name: Mar 04, 2022
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Map Theme: Consulate Embassy Chancery

Each Free Map Friday ZIP contains five 5100x3300 pixel (600 dpi) high-resolution versions of a single dungeon map. Those versions include:

1. Virtual Tabletop (VTT) Map
2. Player Map (With Grids)
3. Player Map (Without Grids)
4. GM Map

boardgame.name: Mar 12, 2022
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Map Theme: Portal Beneath the Ice

Each Free Map Friday ZIP contains five 5100x3300 pixel (600 dpi) high-resolution versions of a single dungeon map. Those versions include:

1. Virtual Tabletop (VTT) Map
2. Player Map (With Grids)

4. GM Map

boardgame.name: Mar 14, 2022 (Bonus Map)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Map Theme: The Path of Virtue

Each Free Map Friday ZIP contains five 5100x3300 pixel (600 dpi) high-resolution versions of a single dungeon map. Those versions include:

1. Virtual Tabletop (VTT) Map
2. Player Map (With Grids)
3. Player Map (Without Grids)
4. GM Map

boardgame.name: Townsfolk II
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This set contains 33 characters depicting various fantasy, medieval townsfolk and some pack animals.

Each file is from 480x 480 and 150 dpi.

boardgame.name: Linkto Animaux
boardgame.description:
Linkto Animaux is a co-operative trivia game in which players team up to find the key amongst the 50 cards that feature unique animals art.

Together, players link all 49 clue cards to the 50 word cards. They then discover whether the remaining, unlinked word card is the key to their victory, validating its code with the answer card to know whether they've won the game!

Linkto Animaux offers five levels of difficulty in the game as well as a competitive mode for those who want it.

boardgame.name: Chaos Cultists
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This set contains 20 characters depicting priests, priestesses, henchmen and crazed villagers who follow the vile chaos gods.

Each file is from 480x 480 and 150 dpi.

boardgame.name: Farm Animals
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This set contains 26 character tokens of animals and two carts. Some of the smaller animals have a larger sized file in case folks wish to make them a "star" character.

Each file is from 480x 480 and 150 dpi.

boardgame.name: Dinosaurs
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This set contains 26 character tokens of dinosaurs including 4 nostalgic, fantasy beings..... the Sleestaks.

Each file is from 480x 480 and 150 dpi.

boardgame.name: Spellcasters 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This set contains 22 character tokens of the spell-slinger sort. Druids, mages, warrior priests and necromancers are included.

Each file is from 480x 480 to 980 x980 pixels and 150 dpi.

boardgame.name: Wastelanders 3
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This contains 20 characters of the wasteland theme. Some "factions" which have been requested, from popular worlds have been included.

Each file is 480x 480 pixels and between 100 to 150 dpi.

boardgame.name: Steel Scavengers
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This set contains 20 characters of wasteland, power armored folks and robots.

Each file is 480x 480 pixels and between 100 to 150 dpi.

boardgame.name: Strike Deck Dinos
boardgame.description:
Form your perfect team of dinosaurs, evolve their offense and defense abilities and lead them to victory against your family and friends!

Players select a team of three Dinosaur Characters and then nominate which Dino will be first to battle. They will then select a target from the other players at the table, ready to battle.

All players then race to draw a Strike Card, OR they can elect to swap out their lead Dino for another in their team. Once Strikes or Swaps have been finalised, cards are resolved, with non-Strikes resolved first.

Players can use EVOLVE cards to build up the stats of their Dinos, and use various STRIKES to deal damage to their opponents. If a Dino takes too many hits, that Dino 'retires for healing' and is out of the game!

Players continue to play through rounds, selecting targets, drawing Strikes and resolving evolution and strike cards until only one team is left standing, winning the game!
