boardgame.name: War of the States
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This set contains 23 tokens depicting units of the American civil war, including a cannon and the two ironclad ships of the Union and Confederate armies.

Each file is roughly 480 x 480 pixels and 150 dpi.

boardgame.name: Steampunk Airmen
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This set contains 20 characters depicting airship crewmen and Martian crewmen of the steampunk era. Also included are three airships, two gunboats and a battleship.

Each file is 480 x 480 (or slightly larger) pixels and 150 dpi.

boardgame.name: Steampunk Martians
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This set contains 25 characters, three mounted characters and two airships inspired by the Space 1889 roleplaying game setting.

Each file is 480 x 480 (or slightly larger) pixels and 150 dpi

boardgame.name: Explorers
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This set contains 22 characters of the pulp era stories. Included are safari explorers, investigators, French foreign legion soldiers and "savage" heroes.

Each image is approximately 480x480 pixels and 150 dpi.

boardgame.name: Vigilantes
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This set contains 20 superhero characters inspired by comics, movies and role-playing games.

Each file is 480x 480 pixels, and 150 dpi.

boardgame.name: Proxy War
boardgame.description:
Proxy War immerses players in the conflicts of the modern era where angry citizens take up arms against an oppressive government while lurking foreign powers try to beat their rivals through exploiting war for profit. Proxy War is the ultimate 2-8 player game of cooperation and competition where players become dictators, rebels, and greedy foreign powers.

Rebels & the Government are in a bloody struggle to seize land & secure Resources for the war. Resources are funneled out to the global market through ambitious Foreign Powers, eager to outdo their rivals. And Military Equipment is funneled in for a quick profit or to shore up an ally’s success on the battlefield.

Every 2-3 player match has 1 winner. Every 4-8 player match has 2 winners. Different players have different Victory Objectives. Government and Rebel players are trying to eliminate each other and be the last player on the board. Foreign Powers are competing with one another to be the first to gain 10 Victory Points. The game ends when a player meets their Victory Objective, OR if 10 turns have progressed without anyone winning outright.

Proxy War is made up of 10 turns, with each turn having 3 phases: Collection, Negotiation, Action. During the Collection phase, Government and Rebel players collect Resources cards from the tiles they control. In the Negotiation phase, players trade Resources and Equipment, discuss building Factories together, and coordinating their actions for the Action phase. During the Action Phase, players will have a menu of actions but they can only choose three actions per Action phase (Build, Move, Support, Bombard).

boardgame.name: The World Travelers Society
boardgame.description:
The World Travelers Society is a tabletop adventure game with a strong narrative, inspired by true events sprinkled with bits of a treasure hunt and at the heart of it, a mysterious box.

Your adventure will start with a hand-made wooden box and padlocks with Chinese characters preventing you from getting inside. After opening the main compartment you will go through a myriad of documents and artifacts that will transport you to 1930s Shanghai, when the city was called the Paris of the Orient, catered to every whim of the rich, and became known as a place of vice and indulgence.

Working on the clues in the box alone won’t be enough, being inspired by true stories, people and places you’ll have to go out into the real world to continue your investigation, going down rabbit holes, looking through existing online archives and books, watching videos taken in Shanghai — just about anything to immerse you in the narrative and help you find true traces from the past to help you solve clues in today’s world…

You can play this game alone or with a group. Your ultimate goal is discover the World Travelers Society’s Secret by deciphering one by one all the clues.

Every time you solve a clue, simply enter your answer in the dedicated website. If it's correct, you'll receive a confirmation. You can also use the Hints to nudge you toward the right direction.

boardgame.name: Fuego Card Game
boardgame.description:
Fuego! is a race to get rid of all your cards!
In this game of shifting alliances, players are encouraged to openly plot against each other to prevent opponents from playing all of their cards!

But, beware! When you are about to go out, the other players will try to stop you! Deliberate, strategize and cooperate before “Ya Burnt!”

boardgame.name: Fuego Caliente!
boardgame.description:
Fuego Caliente! is a race to get rid of all your cards! Just like the original version, players are encouraged to openly plot against each other to prevent opponents from playing all of their cards! But, beware! When you are about to go out, the other players will try to stop you! Deliberate, strategize and cooperate before... "Ya Burnt!"

This new version is supercharged with new cards, and a 6-sided die for a gaming experience you will never forget!

boardgame.name: Wildtastic Five
boardgame.description:
Yawning emptiness in the wildlife parks? But not for long! Grab the dice and let's go!
With attractive offers and clever barter deals, you can quickly let the right animals move in with you. Who is wildtastic enough and fills their wildlife park the fastest?

Gameplay:
Choose a die and perform an action:
1) draw new face-down animal-tiles or
2) Turn over animal-tiles according to the result of the dice. Then
a) place an animal for free in your wildlife park and
b) offer the other animal-tiles to your opponents to get new tiles.

But be careful: There are 5 different animal species, in different quantities. Each animal prefers its own territory. So act with caution and overview!

The game ends as soon as the first person has completely filled their wildlife park with the correct animals.

boardgame.name: Human Hunter: The Proof is Out There
boardgame.description:
From the publisher website:
Since far back in the Long Ago, before the eldest elders can remember, legends have spoken of the mysterious human. Beings capable of forming rocks and trees into shelters towering far into the sky. Of flying, even without bearing wings. Of bending and molding their surroundings to meet their slightest whim.

Alas, only the young...the pups, the cubs, the children...believe in human tales. They are stories told to keep our babies safe, to prevent them from wandering out into the night.

Until now. This is Human Hunter. The show where you, a simple Cryptid, venture forth towards the Nevernever looking for irrefutable proof of the elusive beast, the hornless goatman...the Human.

Human Hunter is a narrative storytelling game about the hunt to prove the existence of humanity. For most of the game, you will be playing Cryptids, creatures that exist in legend and rumor, but are not generally accepted by human science. At times, you will be playing the part of the humans. Human Hunter is natively designed to be played with a GM, but a GM is not required. Characters are built on four Traits, four Skills, two Relationships, and one Group using the VEN6 Storytelling System.
boardgame.rpg: Human Hunter: The Proof is Out There

boardgame.name: Secret Identity: Promo Pack
boardgame.description:
5 more identity cards to add to the game. The pack also contains 5 blank cards to create your own identity cards.

Just mix the cards with the other identity cards during set up.

Promo found in Plato Magazine 143 from March 2022.

boardgame.name: Book of Heroes: 10 11th-Level General Feats
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Options for Every Hero

Every Pathfinder Second Edition Hero needs General Feats. Now the best ones are no longer limited to Level 1 options. Grab yourself these 10 new choices for your higher-level character today.

This supplement includes the following feats:

Accustomed to the Dark
Armor Expertise
All-Around Senses
Greater Fleet
Hardened Mind
Sense Thy Enemy
Shield Deflection
Stone Step
Uncanny Acumen
Weapon Expertise

Be the Hero You’ve Always Known You Are With These Awesome Character Options Today.

boardgame.name: Rulebenders: Game Brewer Promo Pack
boardgame.description:
2 cards part of a Promo Pack Game Brewer created to help cover the rising cost of ocean freight.

Description from the publisher:

Adds 2 Flexo cards. They are part of the set collection cards, but because they are found in the Flexo deck they add more choice when creating the sets.

boardgame.name: Weird Fates vol. 01
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“A cornucopia of four short, open-ended adventure outlines leading to lands of pure imagination, this collection should astound and entertain any company of players interested in exotic locales, strange individuals, and a generous helping of satire. Herein, you will journey to a tropical island to answer the eternal question, “What is Art?” (or die trying); confront a reclusive artist with a peculiar scheme to enlarge his audience; find the fabled graveyard of the elephants and partake of the fruits of the Tree of Forever Return; and judge a pie-baking contest in a rural backwater where nothing could possibly go wrong... or could it? Some assembly required!”

A 40-page anthology of four mini-modules for 3rd to 6th level characters, Weird Fates offers scenarios with a strong emphasis on player creativity and a non-linear structure. With cover art by Peter Mullen, and illustrations by Graphite Prime, Cameron Hawkey, and Vincentas Saladis, this collection epitomises “weird fantasy” with its outlandish concepts, strange denizens, and grotesque situations. Short, sweet, and high on imagination (in multiple senses), this is a sure pick for GMs who enjoy a little improvisation.

boardgame.name: カワーズ (KAWARS)
boardgame.description:
カワーズ (KAWARS) is a two player duelling card game from Japan. Frogs are at war, and both armies face off in a battle.

Both players draw from a single deck, which has only 16 cards, and play (summon) frog cards face-down or face-up on their playmat. The frogs have values for attack and defence, and if an attacking frog has a higher attack than the opponent's defence value, it wins.

Cards are either played up as attack cards, and immediately attack, or sideways as defence cards. Cards played face down do not have to be revealed until attacked.

Some of the frogs have special abilities, which are triggered immediately they make an attack. For example, a Knight can switch the mode of one of the opponent's summoned Frogs from ATTACK to DEFENSE, and vice versa.

Each player has ten hit points at the start, and if an attack penetrates the defence, the player loses hit points. Crucially, if the deck is exhausted, the player with the fewest hit points wins. But if the deck is still in play, the player at zero hit points first loses.

The game is published in a Black edition and a White edition, with different frog armies with different strengths and special abilities.

The publisher also has the game online, and you can play either deck against a bot or other players.
user summary

boardgame.name: Raíces
boardgame.description:
It has been a long time since Cherry “the Good Magician” lost her grandfather in the great magical battle that would change the world of Kawarando forever. Since then, the young magician has been taking care of the Magical Forest with the help of her inseparable friend Ito, a brave and crazy character from the culopochos village. Together they take care of the crops in the garden where the best obakameshi (consciously evolved foods) fruits and vegetables grow, and that's not an easy task. When the harvesting season arrives, they must face the so-called Bad Roots, who will not hesitate to bite the harvesters and try to eat the other obakameshi roots.

In this game there are 3 types of root cards: radishes, turnips and carrots. Although the 3 are differentiated by the back side of the cards, they are shuffled together to form an unique playing deck. After this, the first 3 cards are placed face down on the table, and the active player will choose which root shoot to draw (reveal). The obtained roots will be placed on the table from left to right, forming rows of each type of root. If a Bad Root appears, it should be placed to the left of the row of cards of its root type. If the player doesn't do anything to remove the Bad Root it will eat one root of its type at the end of every turn.If a second Bad Root (no matter what class it is) appears on the same player's table, they will both devour each other. A misterious character named Tomatenstein will also appears on the cards. When it shows up it will take all the Bad Roots that are in play directly to the discard area.

In addition, each player will have 4 Ito action cards from the beginning of the game. With them they can send the Bad Roots to other players' zones, eliminate them, or cancel the last revealed card.

Each root collected has a score. When the cards in the game deck are gone, the game will be over. The player with the most root points will be the winner of the game.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameintegration: La Caza de la Calabaza: Edición Integral
La Caza de la Calabaza: Edición Integral

boardgame.name: Rolling Deep Keep
boardgame.description:
An entry in the Tenfootpole Waverider Keep contest!

From the publishers blurb:

The night is dark and stormy. Terrified riders have arrived from the south, gasping desperate warnings from foaming lips. A dreadful stone tower roams up the coast, somehow riding the waves, disgorging swarms of ravenous lizardmen at every seaside town. Fear the tide, fear the tide!

boardgame.name: Break the Horizon
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book
Most people of the Ninth World live isolated lives. Surrounded by the wild and mysterious unknown, few people in the Steadfast—and even fewer in the Beyond—venture, in their entire lives, more than a few miles from the place of their birth. And they’re happy that way.

But not you. Your dreams extend beyond the horizon. Tales of great wonders and even greater dangers are not cautionary to you—they’re lures, drawing you ever outward to discovery and adventure. The secrets of the prior worlds beckon. But the vast distances, and the dangers they hold, are a daunting barrier. Until now!

Break the Horizon adds mobility to your Numenera campaign. With it you can traverse the vast distances of the Ninth World, finding adventure, encounters, and treasures along the way. This book contains:


New mounts, commonplace vehicles, numenera vehicles, and cyphers and artifacts that aid in travel. Plus, a comprehensive index of all travel options from every Numenera product to date.
New travel-related equipment PCs can purchase, salvage, or craft.
New creatures and NPCs to encounter along the way.
Travel-themed GM intrusions, plus an expansive chapter on hazards and encounters: pepper them into any adventure or travel interlude, or use them as seeds for entire new adventures.
The Safe Wayfarer Travel Guide, full of useful in-world advice from seasoned Ninth World travelers.
Plus two full adventures that can be integrated into the PCs’ travels or used at their destinations.

boardgame.name: The Animals of Baker Street
boardgame.description:
Enjoy an original setting in which animals lead investigations! In this narrative game, play as four different animals, just as clever as they are witty, who encounter mysterious situations. Meet characters, gain objects, collect information, and piece them together to unravel the mystery! The Animals of Baker Street is a thrilling investigative game for the entire family with a unique setting, enhanced by the talented pen of famous youth’s author, Clémentine Beauvais and Sherlock games specialist Dave Neale.

In the game, you collectively choose the places to visit to meet and interact with the quirky animal characters of Baker Street. Decide if you want one of your detectives to use their particular abilities to collect valuable information and discover new clues. But as you visit more places time is ticking by, so choose your path wisely.

Try to solve the case within the given time to win!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Faerie Mysteries (PF2)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Wonders of Faerie Await!
Faerie Mysteries explores the influence of fey creatures and the faerie realms on a Pathfinder Second Edition campaign world. It is not so much about monsters and magic as it is about how the influence of the fey can change the feel and flow of a campaign, and it gives you a game-mechanical system for describing and representing that in-breaking of raw, untamed, primal magic that make the fey what they are. Fey do not simply walk about within the world; they carry their version of the world along with them and make our world more like theirs with every step. The rumors and ripples and ruptures in our reality really lay the groundwork for enriching any campaign where civilization is not the only power in the world, and where the force and spirit of nature can push right back.

Like its upcoming companion products, Faerie Bargains and Faerie Passions, this book provides a fantastic primer on the use of fey creatures in a campaign, balancing the hardcore game rules with explorations of fey creatures' mythological origins and role in real-life history and legends. What this product is really about is making fey different, to make them strange, unpredictable, and menacing in turn. They are never quite what you expect, and this product describes subtle shifts you can use to create an interesting variety of alternate creatures. The fey represent the raw and wild extremes of the life and spirit of the land and those that dwell within it, possessed of a mercurial emotionality and an integration with the natural world that flits between an impossibly saturated hyper-reality and the dreamily surreal. A campaign featuring the fey should feel different than other campaigns, and when you introduce Faerie Mysteries, it will.

boardgame.name: Malkor's Menagerie
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

High strangeness surrounds the arrival of a traveling menagerie in this classic medieval fantasy adventure for 3-5 players.

boardgame.name: Dragonquest: Fantasy Dice Game
boardgame.description:
A thematic and brutal roll and write adventure game for fearless adventurers, based on the Drakborgen (Dragonquest).

Players explore the ruins trying to reach the treasure chamber in the center of the dungeon and escape alive with as much treasure as possible. A limited number of turns before the game ends puts pressure on players to take risks and score rewards because anyone left in the dungeon when time runs out dies!

Your way through the ruins is tracked on your adventure block that also tracks your status. On a turn, players:

Cross off the next space of the sun track. When you cross off the last (19th space), this is your final turn.
Roll the four (custom) black and one red movement die. You are allowed two re-rolls, but every time you roll a skull the die is locked and set aside. If you roll three skulls, you do not move or gain items. Otherwise, you will use your results to draw a path on your sheet, or they might force you to encounter monsters or create obstacles.
Roll the danger dice to determine what type of encounter you will have.


If you run out of 13 Life Points, you die and are out of the game. The player who collects the most treasure and lives is the winner.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Combo Fighter: Plotmaker Edition, Pack 1
boardgame.description:
Combo Fighter is a card-driven tribute to the classic arcade fighting games.

Take on the roles of iconic fighters and string together cards to unleash powerful combos.

But be careful. Your deck is also your life bar. Every move you make and every hit you take drains your energy.

To become a true Combo Fighter champion you must make every hit count.

boardgame.name: Peter Pan
boardgame.description:
Welcome to Neverland! Become Peter Pan, Wendy, Tinker Bell, Tiger Lily or even Wendy's brothers, John and Michael. Go out on a quest to find the Lost Boys who... got lost on the island. Explore every location, lead the other players wisely to finding some of the Lost Boys (the ones you know where to find). You will need to cooperate to find them all. After the game, the island will change for a next search.

After choosing your character and learning about your special abilities, each player is responsible for hiding a pirate and a Lost Child. Thanks to a hand of Clue cards representing dreams made by the characters, each player can give clues on the location of the Lost Children or the pirates to avoid. These Clue cards are played on another player’s board by placing them on a “scale” of “relevance” ranging from Exactly to Not at all. The player will then need to correctly interpret the clue to move around and search for the Lost Children in the correct area. The game is won when 5 Lost Children have been found, but it ends if you encounter the pirates more than 2 times. At the end of a game and depending on its success, a dice roll will change the topology of the island, bring new rules and decide how you pursue your adventure: if you lost, the island may become easier to explore or bring new characters to help you, but if you won, new characters and a new type of island will make your new adventure a bit more difficult quest.

Welkom in Nooitgedachtland! Kruip in de huid van Peter Pan, Wendy, Tinker Bell, Lily de tijgerin, of zelfs Wendy's broers, John en Michael. Ga op zoek naar de Verloren Kinderen die... nou ja - verdwaald raakten op het eiland. Verken alle plaatsen, leid wijselijk de andere spelers om enkele van de Verloren Kinderen te vinden, althans die waarvan je weet waar ze zijn. Het zal nodig zijn samen te werken om ze allemaal te vinden. Als je ze gevonden hebt, evolueren de topologie en de gevaren van het eiland voor het volgende spel!

—description from the publisher (Dutch)
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Peter Pan

boardgame.name: Little Town: Artisans
boardgame.description:
Little Town is a clever and accessible strategy worker placement game, designed to be played with family but also between more experienced gamers. Simple to handle, its depth allows everyone to quickly develop their own way to play.

Calling all Artisans! Specialists are heading into the valley and working on new buildings like the school, museum, and forge…
Collecting resources and constructing structures has never been so easy! That is, as long as each worker is assigned to the right tasks.

After each action taken by your worker, you can specialize it into either Gathering Resources or Building. Once done, it will grant you a bonus for this specific action for the rest of the game.

More resources, more buildings, more victory points, more fun!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Los Futbolísimos: Campo 4
boardgame.description:
Los Futbolísimos is a simple and fast card game in which you are going to send your best players to steal balls and score many goals. But before, you are going to have to assemble the goal!

Los Futbolísimos is a collection of adventures, friendship, mystery and football. This game starts with a strange invitation. Los Futbolísimos are summoned to the Campo4 tournament. It is a very mysterious tournament with rules on the field of play that are very different from those known. Nothing there is what it seems. The adventure of playing with Los Futbolísimos in Campo 4 and overcoming the challenge to win the match is shared.

Each of the characters will have an associated action. The objective will be to have the greatest number of balls of the same color as the associated goal.

There will be a total of four goals, being necessary for each player to have their own to end the game. The colored balls multiply throughout the competition, going from goal to goal. The goals will not be decided until the end.

On each turn, you have to decide which is the best action to apply. It is also essential to know when to use certain key cards such as the free kick, the referee, the VAR... And of course you have to be flexible because the game is constantly changing.

boardgame.name: Clue: Finding Nemo
boardgame.description:
“Just keep swimming” and solve the mystery to win this undersea version of the classic mystery game, based on Disney and Pixar’s beloved franchise!

In Clue: Finding Nemo, forgetful Dory has gotten lost while playing hide and seek, and it’s up to her friends to find her!

Take on the roles of the movies’ finned and feathered characters to figure out what perils Dory may face, who will have to help in the plan to find her, and where she’ll ultimately be found!
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: Cluedo / Clue (Parker Brothers, et al)

boardgame.name: Blaster Bolts (#4 - The Ballad of La Jineta)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This issue of Blaster Bolts features

New ships and new rules for ships by system creator James M. Spahn
A new story by scifi writer Thea Seals - The Ballad of La Jineta
New White Star scenario set in an asteroid mine with the foreboding title of - They Dug too Deep

boardgame.name: Bronze: Save the Dragon, Save the World
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A dragon is an adventurers best friend

The idyllic town of Evershade is about to get a lot less peaceful.

Nestled in a small valley near the border of two kingdoms, Evershade is a small but prosperous town. But ranchers have been finding their livestock slaughtered, with no idea what's behind it. What begins as a simple mission to scare off a predator, turns into a race across hills and mountains to prevent agents of evil from destroying a future force for good.

Includes

A adventure for 4-5 characters of 3rd to 4th level
A regional map of the areas surrounding the town of Evershade
Descriptions of the town of Evershade and several of the notable NPCs that live there
A map of the dragon's lair on a cliff near the sea
Stat blocks for all monsters

boardgame.name: Wilderness Dressing: Mountains (2.0 - OSR)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Wilderness Dressing: Mountains presents:

Minor Events: One table (100 entries) presenting minor events to enliven your characters’ wilderness travel.
Minor Dressings: One table (100 entries) presenting interesting minor terrain features of note.
Uneventful Day's Travel: One table (20 entries) presenting descriptions of uneventful days on the road.
Campsites: One table (20 entries) presenting campsites to add details to your characters' overnight wilderness trips.
Random Encounters: One table (12 entries) presenting ready to use random encounters.

boardgame.name: Bayt al Azif (Issue 04)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Issue #4 includes:

3 adventures dual-statted for Call of Cthulhu 7th edition and GUMSHOE (Trail of Cthulhu)
A group of strangers awakens in an unfamiliar place (Classic Era 1930s, 10 pages)
A death sets off a search for an unorthodox architect (Classic Era 1930s, 15 pages)
A mysterious ancient box leads into dark events (Classic Era 1920s, 15 pages)
An overview of every Cthulhu Mythos RPG release of 2020
A roundtable on streaming horror RPGs
An interview with Mike Mason, the creative director for Call of Cthulhu
Advice, history, comics, and more!

boardgame.name: Nerovia I: Players Pamphlet
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Nerovia is a land existing in a world of nightmares. This ancient place struggles against spirits, disease, and the unknown. The people are busy surviving between lunar cycles and harvest season. The winters are long. The mountains are steep. Sorrow so clouds this land that the shadows lead the living.

In this pamphlet are the offerings to any intrepid enough to brave the dangers of Nerovia. This product includes a regional map, brief history of the setting, skill origins and 3 new classes to replace high fantasy race/classes.

Enter Nerovia at your own peril.

boardgame.name: Nerovia II: Referee's Pamphlet
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Nerovia is a land existing in a world of nightmares. This ancient place struggles against spirits, disease, and the unknown. The people are busy surviving between lunar cycles and harvest season. The winters are long. The mountains are steep. Sorrow so clouds this land that the shadows lead the living.

In this pamphlet a gamemaster is supplied with all they need to run a campaign in the Nerovia setting. The various organizations, areas, and settlements of the region laid bare. The dark fantasy setting is populated with fiendish denizens and depraved souls, corrupted by a land in darkness.

boardgame.name: Sagrada: The Great Facades – Glory
boardgame.description:
Return to the famous Sagrada Familia cathedral in Sagrada: Glory, the third and final of the Great Facades expansions. This modular expansion explores the thrill of competition and rivalry—add everything inside or handpick modules to enhance your crafting experience.

Sagrada: Glory introduces new options to test your artisanal skills! All new Strife Dice are now available in addition to the drafting pool with restrictions on their placement. Be the first to achieve new objectives with Pioneer Cards, and be rewarded for your unique style with the private objectives in the Flourish Module.

boardgame.name: Stop the Virus
boardgame.description:
Stop the virus. Will you be the first to get immune from all 4 viruses? Protect yourself properly and move through the dashboard. Overcome situations that can infect you and try to torpedo your rivals advancement with viruses you may leave on the way. Think you know how to protect yourself? Let's check it. Play

Plays roll temperature and normal dice to move around the board. At each space, they turn over a virus card or collect a protection card. if they get a virus card, they must try to cure it, using the protection cards they've collected. The first to cure 4 infections wins.

boardgame.name: Solomani Front
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:
The scene of bitter fighting in the Solomani Rim War, tensions still run high in the Solomani Front. In the Solomani Rim, hard-liners agitate for a campaign to retake Terra from the Imperials whilst dissidents plot secession from the Solomani Confederation. In Alpha Crucis, independent worlds seek to chart their own course despite interference from the Confederation.

The Solomani Front is a land of opportunity, lying between the open worlds of the rimward fringe and the vast markets of the Imperium. Cross-border trade and diplomacy form a backdrop for covert operations, intelligence-gathering missions and backstreet skullduggery. With factions pushing their own agendas at the expense of others, the knife and the bomb are tools of diplomacy to many.

Under pressure from within and without, the Confederation struggles to maintain its independence and preserve its unique spirit. It is here that the Solomani claim to superiority will be tested; in the crucible of the Solomani Front.

Inside you will find:


Several new playable alien races, including the Selenites, Aquamorph Humans, Apes, Gurungan and Ladybugs.
The Vegans and the Vegan Autonomous District are explored in detail, including Vegan Travellers and a Vegan High Guard expansion.
The much-maligned Crusader superheavy tank, the Galvan Corrosive Environment Construction Platform, the Hunterfoils of Bellerophon, the sometimes lethal Torbellino Speeder, and many other vehicles found throughout the Solomani Front.
Many new ships found in this region of Charted Space, including the Kestrel Aerospace Fighter, Scorpion Strike Boat, Mountain Logistics Barge, and the Daring Fleet Destroyer.
Animals, diseases and other hazards native to the worlds of both the Solomani Rim and Alpha Crucis sectors.

boardgame.name: Terraforming Mars: Utopia Planitia
boardgame.description:
Utopia Planitia is a fan-made board with the following new milestones and awards:

Milestones

Specialist - have 3 special tiles
Pioneer - have 3 colonies
Trader - have minimum 3 different nonstandard resources
Metallurgist - minimum 5 of any combined steel and titanium production
Researcher - have 4 science tags


Awards

Suburbian - most tiles on the rim of the board
Investor - most earth tags
Botanist - most plant production
Incorporator - most played project cards cheaper or equal to 10MC
Metropolist - most cities

boardgame.name: Sudan Jihad
boardgame.description: A military miniature skirmish game designed for fast action between small groups of Mahdists and Egyptians. The game primarily covers the period 1880 through 1885 in the Darfur and Kordofan regions of Sudan. The illustrated rules include a brief history of the conflict, scenarios and translucent movement and artillery templates.

boardgame.name: Heart of Darkness
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The company found a new lifeform, and they want you to study it. Their offer’s uncharacteristically generous—you catalog this organism, determine how they can use it, and bring it back so they can slap their patent on it. Fairly routine stuff. In exchange, they’ll hook you up with a cushy corporate department head position, secure you a book deal, and make sure the institute of your choice gives you tenure. Did I mention the money? There’s a lot of it. Simple survey, sample, and analysis job. Seemed too good to be true.

Of course, it is.

Heart of Darkness is a complete Cinematic Scenario for the ALIEN roleplaying game. It requires either the ALIEN RPG core rulebook or the boxed Starter Set to play. In this scenario, players take the roles of an extrasolar science team with a mystery to solve. While it is a standalone adventure, Heart of Darkness also serves as a conclusion to the Draconis Strain Saga begun in the cinematic scenario Chariot of the Gods and continued in Destroyer of Worlds. Heart of Darkness is designed for 3–5 players plus the Game Mother and is a spiraling descent into soul-crushing madness.

A solo TTRPG made with inspiration from various roguelike games. Learn the game's systems and use them to your advantage!

boardgame.name: Marvel: Remix
boardgame.description:
In Marvel: Remix, players build a team of heroes and allies to take on infamous villains. They are dealt a hand of seven cards that will contain characters, items, or locations from throughout the Marvel Universe. Then, players go about can arming their characters with powerful equipment or maneuvers and use their cards to pull off epic combos. The player that has the most points at the end of the game wins.

The game box comes with 61 Remix cards, 18 Villain cards, a score pad, and a rulebook. This game is for two to six players, ages 12 and up, and plays in 20 minutes.

Rules System: WB-95

boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Wielkie Bitwy 1939-45 (Dragon / Taktyka i Stategia)

boardgame.name: Darwin Awards Party Card Game
boardgame.description:
Welcome to Darwin Awards party card game! Do you enjoy reading or hearing about the crazy things that people do that sometimes end up with them being amongst the nonliving…in other words, someone doing something really stupid and dying. Do you like to make fun of your family, friends, perfect strangers, or maybe a celebrity? Then Darwin Awards party card game is for you!

Darwin Awards is comprised of 4 different decks of cards; there are Location, Action, Object, and Death cards. For advanced gameplay, you can add a 5th deck, Announcement cards.

Each player is dealt 2 of each type of card. One player starts off as the Judge. Starting with the player to the Judge’s left, the players will use the cards in their hand to make up a story. The story will be how someone dies by the Death card at the location stated in the Location card by doing an action from the Action card with an object from the Object card. Example: Location Card – Windsor Castle, Action Card – Doing the Chicken Dance, Object Card – Moon Shoes, Death Card – Choked on a bottle cap

Once each player has told their story, the Judge then chooses the story they liked best. The winning player will keep the Death card to track how many rounds won and all used cards are set off to the side. The player to the Judge’s left will be the next Judge and deals a fresh set of cards to each player and new stories are told. The first player to collect 3 (or as many as the group wants to play) Death cards is the winner of the game.

boardgame.name: Nestlings
boardgame.description:
Nestlings is a 1-4 player dice worker placement, set collection, hand management game with a dash of area majority, and end-game-bonuses mixed in.

In Nestlings, players assume the roles of birds who are venturing into various biomes in order to collect food to bring back to their nests. Each biome features unique food items for your worker birds to find in order to best serve the needs of their Nestlings back in the best.

Players score points based on which food resources have been gathered and placed according to the needs of their Nestlings, as well as points scored using variable end-of-game scoring cards.

At the end of the game, the player who has best satisfied the needs of their Nestlings is the winner.

boardgame.name: Go Extinct!: Stardust Catches the Carnivores
boardgame.description:
Go Extinct! Stardust Catches the Carnivores is a new special edition of the award-winning Go Extinct! tabletop card game, incorporating artwork and concepts from the Stardust series of science books for young readers.

Players complete sets of animals based on actual genetic clades, working to collect the most sets by inferring the other player’s cards and identifying common ancestors on the evolutionary tree. By the end, players will deeply understand the amazing fact that every carnivoran alive today — from the house cat to the polar bear — descended from a single prehistoric ancestor, the miacid!

Based loosely on Go Fish, the goal is for players to collect as many sets of closely related animals as possible. The sets are "clades" of closely-related animals on the evolutionary tree board, which players use for reference. Players take turns asking another player for cards, and if they do not have a matching card, they say "Go Extinct!". The gameplay is more strategic than Go Fish because players can ask either for a specific card or a matching card at any level of the tree hierarchy, thus trading off the specificity of the result for the likelihood of a match.

boardgame.name: Dragonball Z: Lo Scontro Finale
boardgame.description:
Iconic characters from the Dragon Ball saga begin their search of power in various places (i.e. picking up power-up tokens from locations across the board), each trying to boost their own martial skill.

When a player reachs the total of 27 points between all his character's stats, he can announce a tournament!
The others then fight in duels amongst them, trying to eliminate each other, following a matching rank based on their respective character's stats: fourth fights against third, the winner fights against second, winner gains the right to challenge the first. He who can prevail in the tournament's final, is the most powerful warrior!

From the back of the box:
"Un percorso appassionante alla conquista delle sette Sfere del Drago"
("An epic journey conquering the seven Dragon Balls")

boardgame.name: Headless Horseman Board Game
boardgame.description:
Welcome to the Headless Horseman board game! You are Ichabod Crane racing through the haunted woods. Can you be the first player to reach the covered bridge and not be defeated and turned into a Headless Horseman?

Each player chooses a numbered movement card to play, discards that card and moves their game piece then draws a replacement movement card so they maintain 6 cards in their hand. Play rotates to the left each time with players moving their pieces along the paths through the haunted woods. At the beginning of the 4th round, each player is dealt a Curse card but players don’t look at it. As each player begins their 4th turn, in order they will turn over the Curse card to see if they have been cursed and become a Headless Horseman.

Staying in the playing order, the Headless Horseman player(s) will use their movement cards to chase down the remaining Ichabods and turn them through battle. If Ichabod runs out of hit points, they are converted to a Headless Horseman. If a horseman runs out of hit points, they are sent back to one of the graveyards and can continue the chase. Any Ichabod that reaches the covered bridge on the opposite side of the board wins, but if all players are turned to horsemen, the horsemen win.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Books: The Legend of Sleepy Hollow

boardgame.name: The Alamo
boardgame.description: Knight Designs’ “The Alamo,” a 6mm miniatures playset including figures, buildings and rules. The rules include movement, firing tables, melee, morale and painting instructions for the figures. The rules could be used with any 6mm scale Alamo game.

boardgame.name: Pitas Pitas Palomitas
boardgame.description:
Players play city pigeons who must find the best place to feed. Fortunately, the parks with their little old men and their bags of crumbs are the best option to do it. Although the park is very large and the number of idle old people is high, so is the population of pigeons, so the players will wage a fierce battle to be the pigeon that has worn the most boots for 12 days.

You will need a great intuition and animal instinct as well as a good dose of luck to achieve it.



Los jugadores encarnan a palomas de ciudad que deben buscar el mejor lugar donde alimentarse. Afortunadamente los parques con sus viejecillos y sus bolsas de migas son la mejor opción para hacerlo. Aunque el parque es muy grande y la cantidad de viejetes ociosos alta, también lo es la población de palomas por lo que los jugadores libraran una encarnizada batalla por ser la paloma que más se ha puesto las botas durante 12 días. Necesitaras una gran intuición e instinto animal además de una buena dosis de suerte para lograrlo.

boardgame.name: Upshot: A Disc Golf Game
boardgame.description:
Upshot: a Disc Golf game is a disc golf themed flicking game where players set up a course using the box and its contents to create obstacles.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Princess and the P's
boardgame.description:
The Princess is in quite a predicament—the Prince’s parents have put her to the test of pinpointing a plethora of preposterous paraphernalia planted beneath a pile of 20 poofy mattresses. If she passes the prerequisite, she’ll gain the Prince’s proposal, bringing peace and prosperity to the province. But how could anyone perceive such puny protuberances beneath all that padding?
The palace peons are here to help her prevail.

The Princess and The P's is a playful parlor word game in which all but one of the players (the Palace Peons) prompt the remaining player (the Princess) to guess a collection of secret objects whose names contain the letter P. If a Peon prevails, they’ll procure pearls as prizes. But they must take precautions not to use ANY words that contain the letter "P” (lest they procure penalties)... Players help the Princess prevail, and compete for the title of MVP (most valuable peon) in this semi-cooperative game.

Game Crafter Word-Up Challenge contest entry

boardgame.name: Pigeon Pie
boardgame.description:
The queen has grown tired of the same old pies. Potatoes, onions, pigeons, blackbirds…all of these ingredients have been declared ho-hum by her majesty. In an attempt to inspire her kitchen staff to be more innovative with their cooking, her Royal Highness has invited culinary experts from lands near and far to gather for an international feast in the Great Hall. She has chosen members of the court with the most discerning palates to taste these exotic pies, take notes, and give her their assessment of the flavors inside each dish. The taster with the most robust pallet will be promoted to head of the kitchen staff—a very prestigious position indeed.

In Pigeon Pie, players assume the roles of the queen’s royal pie-tasters. Each round, they will be served a pie with 6 slices (letters). They must try to detect all the subtle flavors contained in the pie by writing down as many “ingredients” (words) as possible using only the letters in the pie. They’ll gain points for original words, higher letter counts, and for identifying words with a culinary theme.

Game Crafter Word-Up Challenge contest entry

boardgame.name: Speed-E-Scoops!
boardgame.description:
Welcome to Speed-E-Scoops—the mom ‘n’ pop ice cream shop with international flair!

It's the height of summer, and the Speed-E-Scoops is a busy place, with many customers waiting in line to sample your scoops. You and your coworkers compete to see who can churn out the tallest cones and satisfy customers with the right flavor combos. When the shift is over, who will go home with the most tips?

In this ice-cream stacking word game, players draft ice cream scoops (letters) and compete to stack them into cones (words) while managing their workspace, a line of customers, and special requests. Earn points based on the length of each word, plus bonus points for taking care of customer needs. To win, end the game with the most points.

Game Crafter Word-Up Challenge 2022 contest entry

boardgame.name: Asteroid Empire
boardgame.description:
As the CEO of a new asteroid mining space start-up, your job is to make the most money from exploring nearby asteroids for precious resources. Coordinate your ships and their crew to claim and extract everything they can from these asteroids and return them to Earth for the biggest profit. The more you control the supply of one type of resource the more money you can make. But watch out for other competitors who want to expand their asteroid mining empires too!

Asteroid Empire is a 9 card game that puts rival CEO's of asteroid mining start-ups against each other to make the most profit. Can you make the most money and expand your space mining empire?
The aim is to be the mining start-up with the most money once all of the nearby asteroids have been mined and the game ends.

The game is played over a number of rounds in which players can explore or mine each asteroid. The player with the start token goes first, once they have placed a ship their opponent gets to place a ship and play continues to alternate until both players have placed all their ships (to either explore or extract) and the round ends. Once a ship has been placed in a round it cannot be moved or returned to the players hand. At the end of each round both players will retrieve all their ships and the start token is passed to the other player who will then go first in the next round. The remaining asteroids are not shuffled and left in the same order.

Once the last asteroid is claimed to be mined then the game ends and the materials extracted can be counted to determine who generated the most income. The income each resource is worth depends on how many cards of that resource each player has and is listed on each asteroid card with that resource type.

boardgame.name: Cosmic Race
boardgame.description:
As intergalactic pilots, you are finally living your dream: participating in a super space race! You are so excited to line up for the start of this wild race. But pay attention to other spaceships and any other obstacles that could slow you down! Quickly cross the finish line and collect the most stars to win the Cosmic Race!

On each turn reveal the control tiles to manoeuvre your spaceship on the track and collect stars. Increase your speed, chose direction but be careful to not lose control or your spaceship will crash!

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: Title: Cosmic Race Publisher: Loki Language(s): English German French Dutch Spanish Italian

boardgame.name: Tentacolor
boardgame.description:
Deep in the ocean lives a strange and mysterious creature. The only thing we know about it is its amazingly colorful tentacles! Scientists have made several expeditions, but they’ve never managed to photograph this creature, which they’ve named Tentacolor. They’re relying on you, intrepid explorer!

Dive to the ocean’s depths, find Tentacolor, and take photos of its beautiful tentacles. You’ll need to be smarter than the other explorers, since only one of you can photograph Tentacolor in its entirety!

Tentacolor is a drafting game for our younger players. On each turn, chose one of your cards, make the color match with the tentacle you are building and try to block your opponents.

The first player that matches 5 Tentacle cards wins.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet

listing.notes: Title: Tentacolor Publisher: Loki Language(s): English German French Dutch Spanish Italian

boardgame.name: À la manière d'Arcimboldo
Arcimboldo
boardgame.description:
Arcimboldo and his students must each create a “work” with composition elements: fruit, vegetables, flowers and cereals. They must make the best interpretation of a title, with a word and a qualifier both chosen by Master Arcimboldo.

The game is played in rounds. The Master Arcimboldo takes a label half with a noun on it, and a label half with a qualifier. The Master assembles the labels (front and back allow for 4 combinations). Once the combination is chosen, the Master announces the title and places it on the table so that everyone can read it. Then the Master Arcimboldo launches the round. Each player simultaneously creates their work.

As soon as a player has finished their picture, they rotate their Frame board so that other players can see it in the correct direction. Once a frame has been rotated, the work cannot be changed. Once everyone has finished and commented on their work, players vote for the work they find most convincing. The player with the most votes for their work is the winner of this round, and they gain the labels. In case of a tie, the Master Arcimboldo chooses who wins the tie. The player to the left of the current Master becomes the new Master Arcimboldo. A new round can now begin!

The game ends when each player has been Master Arcimboldo twice (for 3-4 players games) or once (for 5-6 players games).

The player with the most labels wins the game.

boardgame.name: Mini Blitz Medieval
boardgame.description:
Blitz Built Games is the card game that brings a core rule system to your favorite characters. Use one of the four Mini Blitz decks to equip four of your Lego​™ Minifigs with Medieval, Firearms, Lasers, or Magical Equipment. ​We provide a unique system made to open up into any and all of your favorite genres and you provide the rest. Bring your own characters, victory conditions, and game style.

Medieval brings sharp weapons and pointy objects to your army.

Gameplay:
This Mini Blitz Deck can equip four units with a total of 8 BV (Battle Value). Assign a Form/Class card to a Minifig, which defines the basic rules for a single unit, then assign Equipment cards; each assigned card provides special rules but reduces the unit's Top Speed.

The scenario sets, or players agree, a Round BV. During your round, pay a unit's BV to activate it. When your Round BV is exhausted, play passes to the next player. During a unit's turn, it can Play an equipped card, Attack, or Move. Attacks are resolved by rolling 1d6 and checking the Attack Table on the equipment card, plus any special rules. Range and movement is measured in studs.

boardgame.name: It's a Bomb!
boardgame.description:
“Bomb detected at the forty-seventh floor. Repeat: bomb detected at the forty-seventh floor of NeoMed Corp. Requesting immediate intervention.”

It's a Bomb! is an asymmetric cooperative game of logic and deduction in which 2 to 5 players will try to defuse a bomb. Together with your team you'll have to analyze the bomb's circuit and understand how it works to deactivate it. At the same time the chief of operations will provide support from command center, making use of various experts. The game includes many scenarios (all replayable many times) of increasing difficulty to give you a new and unique experience every time you play.

The game system resembles games like Mastermind or Wordle but on a grid rather than linear. In order to cut the correct cables, it will be necessary to reason crossing the information obtained on rows and columns of the bomb scheme, combined with the unique abilities skills of the corporation's consultants and the scenario special rules.

boardgame.name: Hâpy Families
boardgame.description:
Oh no! While visiting the pyramid, Hapi accidentally opened a secret door and discovered an ancient tablet. But when he got closer, a God suddenly appeared. “Phew, thanks for finding me! All the other Gods are still hidden in the pyramid. Help me find them, we haven’t played together in ages!

In Hâpy Families you try to collect series of 3 Little gods from the same family to score points! On your turn, pick a god from the pyramid, call for another one in your opponent's hand and try to bring god families together!

Points are scored for series of 3 instead of entire families. Gather 6 of a kinf for an instant win.

The number of points needed to win depends on player count.

listing.notes: Title: Hapy Families Publisher: Loki Language(s): English German French Dutch Spanish Italian

boardgame.name: Farm & Furious
boardgame.description:
What’s all the fuss in the barnyard? Ducklings, rabbits, dogs and roosters: all animals are ready to race. Teammates call out to each other and cheer: the relay race promise to be thrilling, with unexpected developments!

Cock-a-doodle-doo! The race is on, it’s up to you! Have the proper animals run at the right time and bring victory to your team!

In Farm&Furious, Players chose an animal of their team (card) and reveal them simultaneously to race. Each charachter has its own abilities and will move diferently on the track. Play smartly to cross the finish line first and win the Race!

listing.notes: Title: Farm & Furious Publisher: Loki Language(s): English German French Dutch Spanish Italian

boardgame.name: Bad Decisions
boardgame.description:
BAD DECISIONS is a GM-less, horror-themed, story-telling RPG for 3-6 players. During play you become the hapless characters the audience shouts “NO! DON’T GO IN THERE!” to.

In traditional role-playing games, you often want to do the smartest, safest thing to survive. But here at Arbitrio Games we like our heroes curious, irresponsible, and extremely mortal. The whole point of BAD DECISIONS is to get yourselves killed doing something terribly idiotic.

Over the course of a couple hours, our ill-fated characters are placed in a situation rife for foolishness, such as ghost hunters exploring Colonial Williamsburg or teens trespassing at a dinosaur mini-golf. In this rules-light game, players take turns narrating, rolling dice, and making BAD DECISIONS until you are no longer just hinting at danger: danger is chasing you through a cornfield with a machete.

From there things start to move fast. We shift our focus from narration to a modified version of Liar's Dice, where anyone who gets eliminated gets…err…eliminated. Soon it’s head-to-head and there’s just two of you left. That's when we answer the question:

Are you the Final Girl or were you the Secret Mastermind all along?

boardgame.name: Happy City: Golden Gate of Kyiv Promo Card
Happy City: Porte dorée de Kiev Promo Card
boardgame.description:
Promo card in French for Happy City by Cocktail Game. English language version by GameWright Games.

The card is a special red building.
To build it you will need:
2 yellow building.
2 blue building.

When the card is built, you get one heart for each blue card adjacent to a yellow card (left, right, top or bottom).

Information from publisher GameWright Games:
Last year, our Ukrainian publishing partner chose to localize Happy City in their country. However, they had one significant request: replace the "bonus building" card that features Moscow's Red Square with a Ukraine-centric landmark. Honoring their wishes, our partner reached out to the game's artist who illustrated a vibrant scene that incorporates the iconic Golden Gate of Kyiv along with a monument of Yaroslav the Wise (one of the most famous princes of Kyiv). But just as production was about to start, the conflict escalated, leading up to the tragic situation we now know. As a result, Happy City cannot be released in Ukraine.
Inspired by the actions of our dear partners at Cocktail Games and believing that every little bit helps, we decided to translate this symbolic card into English and offer it as a special release in solidarity with the citizens of Ukraine. For a $5 donation, you can get the card and we will contribute all of the proceeds to Global Giving's Ukraine Crisis Relief Fund.

boardgame.name: Ra.One The Game
boardgame.description:
(from the back cover of the game)
Complete your Ra.One experience

Be the Hero
The darkness of Ra.One's reach has left earth barren and humanity in despair. The few pockets of resistance on earth are powerless against his ever growing forces. Leading a small team of some of the best from the lunar elite forces you must infiltrate his fortress, Zelon, and bring an end to his reign of tyranny forever.

You are our best soldier, but now, humanity asks for more... it asks for a champion rise G.One hero with a H.A.R.T.

- Play as G.One Shahrukh Khan
- Battle in 15 unique arenas
- Blast your enemies away with an array of hi-tech weaponry
- Use items to boost your combat abilities

boardgame.name: Book of Hidden Paths
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Pathfnder 2E core rules say next to nothing about random wilderness encounters. And yet random encounters have been part of fantasy roleplaying games from the very beginning. It's time to bring them back to Pathfinder!

You get 10 main chapters, each devoted to a particular type of wilderness terrain: Caverns, Desert, Forest, Grasslands, Hills, Littoral, Mountains, Ocean, Tundra and Wetlands. After a brief discussion of that terrain type, each chapter launches into a series of tables and sub-tables outlining possible plausible encounters. The random encounter tables include creatures from all three Pathfinder Bestiaries published to date, from familiar wild animals to exotic monsters like ahuizotls and zaramun, plus humanoids, various vocations/professions, and physical hazards that you can use for petty harassment (just to remind your players that adventuring isn't all fun and glory). In turn, each table entry discusses how that creature reacts — topics range from how to acquire a pet rat to what that ancient red dragon is thinking as it looks down at your party — how many of them are present (scaled to your party's average level), and what treasure might be gained from defeating it. Book of Hidden Paths gives GMs a deep dive into an under-explored aspect of RPGs. Even experienced DMs will find food for thought and fresh ideas about how to make a party food for monsters.

boardgame.name: The Book of Chance Meetings
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

So it has always been. The 5th Edition core rules offers a solid discussion of the how's and why's of random encounters, but I think the subject still deserves more. So I wrote Book of Chance Meetings to expand on the subject and give DMs a more thorough idea of what might happen when your party bumps into that group of orcs as they plunge into the forest.

You get 10 main chapters, each devoted to a particular type of wilderness terrain: Caverns, Desert, Forest, Grasslands, Hills, Littoral, Mountains, Ocean, Tundra and Wetlands. After a brief discussion of that terrain type, each chapter launches into a series of tables and sub-tables outlining possible plausible encounters. They cover most of the creatures included in the 5th Edition Standard Reference Document, from familiar wild animals to exotic monsters like kraken and purple worms, plus humanoids, various vocations/professions, and physical hazards that you can use for petty harassment (just to remind your players that adventuring isn't all fun and glory). In turn, each table entry discusses how that creature reacts — topics range from how to acquire a pet rat to what that ancient red dragon is thinking as it looks down at your party — how many of them are present (scaled to your party's average level), and what treasure might be gained from defeating it. Book of Chance Meetings gives DMs a deep dive into an under-explored aspect of RPGs. Even experienced DMs will find food for thought and fresh ideas about how to make a party food for monsters.

boardgame.name: The Blood Mage and Blood Witch Classes for Old School RPGs
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Blood Mage and Blood Witch are specialist magic-user PC classes suitable for your Old School campaign using the world’s oldest and most well-known fantasy TTRPG. In addition, you will find 21 new spells for use with blood casters.

boardgame.name: Stranger Still
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a mini-supplement for Infected, giving further ways that those who have been changed by infection might be altered. These further alterations are grouped into talent trees, each of which progresses from one or more of the original changed talents:

The Handler, building from carrion lord into the ability to control and reshape a huge horror or mangled, mingled flesh.
The Maw, building from rotgut into the ability to inhale infectious roil and vomit forth you own miasmic cloud that acts as you will it to.
The Synapse, building from whispers into the ability to hear and broadcast radio and video, siphon electricity and discharge it.
The Beast, building from weapons and armour into self-transformation into a massively armoured, swift-moving creature that can bear heavy loads (or even a rider).
In addition to these existing talent trees, an assortment of "spare parts" are given so the Guide can modify these talent trees and create more as befits the local situation.

Finally, some further rules are given for how a changed character might accept a progressive transformation so that infection carries them to that goal much less dangerously.
boardgame.rpg: Infected: Tabletop Roleplaying Game in the Eldritch Apocalypse

boardgame.name: Allies & Adversaries
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

And another issue!!! All the heroes and all-to-soon-to-be-villains from the former days. In these action packed pages you'll find First Level and Monster versions of Gladiator, Moon Maiden, Wraith, Green Giant, Rapunzel, Nightengale, Nature Boy, Fire Fly, Cyclone and Ginger Bread Man.

boardgame.name: The Haunted Hills
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Issue #8 of Populated Hexes Monthly moves to the southern end of the Plateau of Leng and introduces a new class for Old School Essentials: the binder, a character that draws their power from the vestiges of dead or forgotten gods.

boardgame.name: Assassin's Creed: Brotherhood of Venice (retail edition)
boardgame.description:
Assassin's Creed: Brotherhood of Venice is a co-operative miniature board game taking place in the heart of the Italian Renaissance through a story-driven campaign of 26 "memories" in Venice, in 1509. Choose your assassins according to their unique abilities, level up during the campaign, and unlock new skills for each of them.

Fight or stay incognito thanks to the equipment found in chests or manufactured by Leonardo Da Vinci. Evade your pursuers by climbing on roofs and towers, then synchronize to reveal new game elements. Bribe your enemies, use secret hideouts to escape patrols, and flip mechanisms to change the level layout. After each memory, fall back to your headquarters to heal your wounds, grow your brotherhood's fame, and craft special equipment. The game features a save system that allows the number of players to vary between each campaign and the level of play adjusts according to the number of players.

The retail edition of Assassin's Creed: Brotherhood of Venice features the same scenarios as the original Kickstarter release and therefore the same gameplay experience. What has changed is that all of the miniatures other than the five detailed assassin figurines have been replaced with standees, so the game includes 5 miniatures, 139 standees, 6 secret envelopes, 41 tiles, and more than 400 cards.

Many surprises await in the sealed envelopes. Meet the many famous personalities you've encountered in the Assassin's Creed video games as well as four unique ones created especially for this game.

boardgame.name: Bravo!
boardgame.description:
Ladies and Gentlemen! The most important circuses in the world are looking for Aerial artists, Acrobats, Equilibrists, Illusionists, Jugglers and Clowns. To ensure success, in addition to bringing memorable attractions, each circus also must offer spectators unique delicacies such as cotton candy, candy apples and popcorn. The circus that best satisfies its audience will be chosen as the greatest show on Earth!

A game of Bravo lasts 17 rounds. In each round, the Master of Ceremonies chooses one of three types of tiles to be acquired by the players: Inner Ring, Outer Ring or Audience. Once the choice is made, a number of tiles equal to the number of players plus one is revealed. A single bid auction is then held to decide who will be the new Master of Ceremonies, who will have the right to be the first to choose one of the open tiles. In a clockwise direction, the other players choose tiles, being able to spend tickets to open new options on the table. When all circuses are completed, players reveal their Ringmaster tile and all artists in each circus are scored. The value of each artist category is added and then multiplied by the number of that category icons in that circus Audience tiles. The player with the most points is the winner.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Soldier of the Queen
boardgame.description: Soldier of the Queen was designed as a fast moving set of rules for Colonial-era battles. Separate tables were created to differentiate between specific combatants in different geographical regions. Tables are included for the Anglo-Zulu War, Sudan, India, the Boxer Rebellion and the Boer wars. SotQ includes rules for movement, infantry and artillery firing, melee, morale and fanaticism.

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Back To The Future: Time Travelling Board Game
boardgame.description:
Travel through the saga timeline. Roll the dice to decide your travels to the past or back to the future!

Similar game play to Snakes & Ladders. Roll the dice and follow the actions required by any cards or events on the board spaces. The first one to the end of the path wins.

boardgame.name: Dead Reckoning: Sea Dogs Expansion
boardgame.description:
These additional crew cards are used to provide asymmetric abilities to each player's deck as a fun alternate way to play or as a part of the Campaign Mode rules used with Saga Expansion 1 Deep Legends. (Saga Expansion 1 not required)

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Jumanji
boardgame.description:
This game has completely different rules from the 1995 version, which was reissued in 2017 in a wooden box but with the same old rules. The rules also seem to be different from the 2019 playable prop replica. The focus of the new game is an actual jungle adventure.

The 2021 version has similar wooden box, but the board now has four undifferentiated pathways over a jungle scene with a waterfall and a volcano and other jungle details. The pawns now look like the rhinoceros figure from the original movie. It comes with two regular six-sided dice, four six-sided "challenge dice", 12 life tokens, and a sand timer. When the lid opens the two sides have the same text as the game in the original movie.

It has a deck of 100 "challenge cards" and a green card reader which doesn't work very well. (There's also an electronic version that reads the text.) On the front of the card is a hidden riddle, from which you're supposed to guess one of 20 categories.

On the back of the card is a "challenge". These range from the sort of dice rolling that was used in the old game to physical role-playing activities like jumping across an imagined chasm or racing to the refrigerator to get a piece of fruit and taking a bite before the timer runs out. There are storytelling challenges like imagining there's a lion and telling how you'd get away from it, acting challenges like having the whole group howl like wolves, and trivia questions relating to the jungle.

If you fail a challenge you lose a life token. If any player loses three life tokens the group as a whole loses the game, but players can give their life tokens to another player.

boardgame.name: Howl
boardgame.description:
Howl is a co-op, open world, tile laying, adventure game for 1-5 players, where you play as wolves and your goal as a team to complete a number tasks along with your pack before the summer days end. Chase, Hunt, Scavenge, and fight for survival in ever changing environment. You may also rescue wolf cubs and make unusual alliances with other species that will help you to access other regions of the map.

In your turn you may select a Wolf and Explore or Howl. To Explore, you pick a tile from the available offer and place adjacent to a tile on the table, matching vegetation. Then, move a wolf to one of the actions available in the newly placed tile (Observe, Get, Hunt, Chase, Give, etc). In order to complete an action, a wolf will roll a number of dice and, if successful, pick the numbered card and add it to the pack inventory. If you, manage to complete a task, or need to heal your wolves or regroup, then you should Howl.

A game ends in defeat if:

One of the players has no remaining wolf or cub, and no other player is able to give them a cub.
You run out of tiles without completing at least 4 tasks.


In this case wolves will learn, regroup, rebuild their strength and numbers and try again in the next time.

Howl has a myriad of paths to victory, multiple endings, puzzles, side quests and events triggered by player choices. The more you adventure, the more the game will reward you for remembering past choices.

boardgame.name: Wilderness Dressing: Mountains (2.0 - PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Wilderness Dressing: Mountains presents:

Minor Events: One table (100 entries) presenting minor events to enliven your characters’ wilderness travel.
Minor Dressings: One table (100 entries) presenting interesting minor terrain features of note.
Uneventful Day's Travel: One table (20 entries) presenting descriptions of uneventful days on the road.
Campsites: One table (20 entries) presenting campsites to add details to your characters' overnight wilderness trips.
Random Encounters: One table (12 entries) presenting ready to use random encounters.

boardgame.name: The Princess and The Tower
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Princess of Edryax has been kidnapped by a cruel and vicious dragon and the nation's King will do anything to see to his daughter's safe return. Tasked with bringing her back safely, your party finds that not is all as it seems for this supposed damsel in distress. What do you do when the princess does not, in fact, need saving?

The Princess and The Tower is a Fifth Edition adventure designed for four to six characters of 5th to 8th level and is optimized for four characters with an average party level (APL) of 7.

This adventure contains 4 new monsters, 2 custom battlemaps, 3 new magic items and 2 musical tracks to bring your session to life!

boardgame.name: Ich will dein Führer sein
boardgame.description:
Each player gets 17 figures: 12 soldiers, 3 officers, 1 general and 1 leader.

At the start of the game the leader is placed on the half globe and the general on space e or f. The 3 officers are placed on the 3 spaces beside the general. The soldiers go on the 12 spaces in front of the officers and general.

The goal of the game 1 to take the opponents leader or to occupy the opponents home space (half globe) or the two general-spaces (e and f).

The leader and the general move 1 space in any direction. The officers move 1 space diagonal in any direction while the soldiers may move only 1 space diagonal forward. Soldiers or officers that get on an opponent general- or officer-space may get promoted.

All figures may take opponent figures only on diagonal adjacent spaces and may take more than 1 opponent if they are standing in a straight line behind the 1st figure.

In a second version of the game a die is used to determinate the number of spaces a figure may move. In this game movement is only diagonal.

boardgame.name: Cardinal Chains
boardgame.description:
A minimalist puzzle game centering on the concept of non-decreasing sequences.

Each puzzle begins with a monochrome grid of numbers, plus a few colored cells marked with an X. Starting at these cells, you must link up numbers in non-decreasing order until the whole grid is filled with color.


500 unique, carefully handcrafted puzzles of varying difficulty, each with a single solution
Beautiful, lengthy chill-out soundtrack created by professional artists
Minimalist, elegant design without timers, scores or other hassles
Several built-in color themes, including colorblind options. Or...


...make your own color themes - right from within the game!

Source: The Game Website.
